description: A little shop where they sell Garrafones.

name: Paddy’s Hostel
description: Parked around the corner at the fire station and took a room for under ten dollars each.  Awesome place.  Super clean and friendly staff.  Definitely make it a stop on your way through beautiful Grenada.

name: MM Recreativo
description: That’s ok, with ac and fan very small the room with the bathroom just separete by a courtain. No wifi. Pool. And a little restaurant inside. 400c for two persons. Very far for the main road.

name: Pizzeria la veccia
description: Delicious thin crust wood fired pizzas for a reasonable price, lots of toppings to choose from

name: Las Vacaciones
description: Nice hostel, Dorms $8 pp. Room with private bath 24 incl. tax, shared bath 20 a night. Not a party place though still mostly younger people. Breakfast included, quiet all the time. Laundry service, good, free WiFi. No parking, but there is a parking not far, 3 blocks down the road, for 30 Cordoba a day. Staff speaks Spanish and English, one of them even German. Close to Center and Supermarket, they have a Kitchen and fridge you can use.

name: River Beach Camp
description: End of the road river camp in a quiet flat spot with hard sand. We made it there slowly in our rwd sprinter. Lots of shade all day long. It is a road for some people to cross to their homes on the other side of the river. We were there in dry season, not sure about wet season conditions. beautiful beaches with empty tide pools perfect for swimming. There were stray dogs and cows passing often as well as motos. No problems with safety but locals did warn us of recent break ins on the other side of town. Feels like tourism is just getting there as there are some hostals and bars and expats starting to emerge. Best sleep we've gotten in Nica. Watch out for ants though... They bite quick. Mosquitos present but not that bad.

name: Big Truck Stop / Restaurante "Parqueo DIXAS"
description: Very large secured / fenced gravel parking lot. Features primitive toilet and shower  (cold) as well as restaurant / bar. Payed 1USD for the night. Suprisingly quiet during the night, trucks leave early in the morning.

name: Unknown
description: It’s a restaurant that they can’t be bothered to open most of the time with lots of space for camping, doesn’t appear to have a name. The woman who runs it is a crazy b****. She has grabbed my arm to drag me into the kitchen to point at a dirty dish that wasn’t ours and generally tells you off a few times a day for random things that are either irrelevant or nothing to do with you. She stole my friends hammock over a dispute about a broken blender that was so old it just fell apart. We camped for $3 per person which is great but there are other places around for the same price. The owner is incredibly difficult to deal with and I would not recommend!

name: la colonia
description: La Colonia - great supermarket for all sorts.  pricey though

name: parqeo
description: secure off street parking. just next to casa San Miguel. $1 from 7pm till 11.30am. gate was closed when we came back from the volcano but the señor happily opened up when we knocked.

name: Family home and beach
description: Javier and his family let us park and camp on his lot.  Right on the water and even got to use kitchen and toilets.  Such a beautiful family. Will be back on the way north for sure. Other future travelers are definitely welcome to stay.

name: checkpoint
description: don't go this way to penas blancas as military checkpoint won't let you through.  Google maps suggests it as the route from la Flor.  think it's military lands!

name: Papagayo
description: A comfy place, clean, on side to the lake and cheap!, $5dls per person on an private room, bathroom is outside is ok. Is difficult to arrive, you have to walk through a path of trees, until the lake, if is night is scary for the darkness, but we arrive at 9pm and nothing happen. We are cyclotravellers so we don’t have problems to arrive,  no car can arrive here. (The place will change of ubication to the center of the Moyogalpa near gas station.)

name: Turtle Hatchery
description:
Scott, a really awesome human, when he came to live here, while he was rescuing all the dogs as he could, he realized that the locals were picking up all the turtle eggs for money, so the way he found to prevent this culture trade and considerable decline of the turtles was to buy the eggs back from the community. If money is the problem then he decided to buy them and also help the community. 

If you want to have an incredible experience volunteering at sanctuary turtle rescue program helping turtles come into the world with your own hands - because it is part of the rescuing protocol, otherwise they would not be saved, and release them in the sand to make their walk to life through the sand, and then contemplate this unique scenario, you shouldn’t miss this place!! If in the season they release every single day between 200-500 baby turtles. Just keep in mind that the opening of the eggs happens around 1:00pm and the turtles sand release around 5:00pm. Check also with Rachel or Matt from Salt Escapes Lodge if it is the right season. https://www.saltescapesnicaragua.com/ 

Scott allowed me to park on his property for free right on the beach. Not easy to drive here, not at all! you must really enjoy driving on dirt roads, but it’s worth it! 

To get here from Managua: Drive north towards Leon turn left onto Camino Salinas Grandes about 25 km from Leon or about 7 -10 mins after the highways meet there is an antenna with a movie star logo on the north west corner. Take the road until there is a fork in the road and then stay right. Continue until just after the cemetery on your left , you will see a road called “Los lirios”. Go left onto that and follow till the clearing. Follow the playa Tesoro signs until you reach the blue wall, then go left. The sanctuary is at the house where the wall ends - Tundra Propriety. (DO NOT FOLLOW GOOGLE MAPS - it will take you to a road that actually it is not correct.

If you do not want to drive through that really tough “Los Lirios” dirt road, another option is to park at Casa de Rigo Sampson and next day you can walk along the sand to the sanctuary, shouldn’t be that far.

Enjoy it!

name: Mirador Volcan San Cristobal
description: Great view of the Volcano and hiking is available also horse ride to top 6 or 4 hours

name: Centro turístico Volcán San Cristobal
description: Cabins 10$ per person 5$ to camp. Hiking or horse ride available to volcano crater. You can call Sr. Fred Fonseca 78711053. We not stay overnight but posible and close to main road an if you combine with the visit to Ron Flor de Caña.

name: Bomberos Rivas
description: It’s a big building. Possible to camp for free in the second floor. With (dirty) bathroom. For Vans or RV maybe space on the public road

name: GM Granada
description: Great little Hostel with pool and bar . Good Kitchen facilities, friendly, helpful staff.  $ 20. US for private room shared bath, $7 more for AC. Free pool table. Dorm Rooms are cheaper. Tidy and clean!  Parking for motorcycle or small car in gate, bigger vehicles park on street .

name: Volcán Cosiguina
description: A large gravel highway is in the end stages of being built, and it's a perfectly nice drive to this point. The road widens into a parking area right across from the trailhead. Trail is basically unmarked, it's not maintained and looks like a slightly overgrown foot path. Very easy hike, about an hour to the top. There's a camping site halfway up, which is marked but seems unmaintained. We stayed in our vehicle in the parking along the main road and went undisturbed, expect for a bit of noise from a tour bus that arrived around 6am

name: Mechanic
description: Good mechanic, who change differents parts quickly for a good price ( 35 $ )

name: Hotel Panamericano
description: Scouted out a few mediocre places nearby and was quite impressed when I found this place. $10 USD per person, per night. They have a pleasant garden, rocking chairs, art, and can help organize canyon tours. They offer $3 breakfast, have wifi, cold showers, and several secure parking spots. Would definitely recommend.

name: Cool Place/ formally Dale Daggers
description: Nice clean place with mini super on site. Dorms, private rooms etc. right on beach . We came on a motorcycle, but looks like overnighting in rig is possible . Big rigs can fit. We had a very nice second level private room with balcony and outdoor kitchen, with refrigerator. 40$ us per night. other rooms are cheaper. One of the nicer rooms we have had on our journey. Nice beach with plenty of pangas to buy fish and lobster from on beach. Good surf near by in season.

name: Pelican
description:
Sweet spot at the north end of playa Gigante.  You may need 4wd or a bit if power at least to get up the last steep bit of dirt road.  Space for one or maybe two cars as well as great tent spot.  Shower is cold and outdoor but nice enough.  Toilet us flush and clean but also pretty much outdoor. 

Rebecca the owner is super nice.

They charged us $5/night to park.  We plugged into the power using an adapter for a light bulb but only saw about 90 volts. 

The have fresh water and a long hose.  Great sunsets and super quiet at night 

WiFi from the Spanish school next door or from various hostels nearby. No ATM in town but a couple if small stores.

name: Playa Tamarindo
description: Nice little spot on lake before crossing to CR

name: Budget hostel la Mexicana
description: Great place for budget travellers. 15usd for a double room with shared bathroom and kitchen access. Location is really good, within walking distance to central plaza etc. The owner is very friendly and nice. There is also a Mexican restaurant but we didnt try it. Wifi is good and fast. You can park your car At a parking lot nearby for 100c per day or a bit further at red cross parking lot for 50c per day as we did. They will surely let you take your bike inside. It isnt the prettiest place in town but for us it was a really good value for money.

name: Malecon San Carlos
description: Parking in front of the lake. Just near the information center. 100m of the main bars and restaurants. Safe

name: Gas station - San Ramon
description: Free parking behind the gas station. Police station at 20m. Square very close.

name: Entrance to Cerro Negro
description: this is the entrance to the sandboard volcano

name: 1 ra Calle NE
description: The Santa Cruz hotel was full, so the lady referred us to this hotel. ( at about 30 meters from there) It was very late so we didn’t have a choice. Rooms are OK, not the cleanest but for 1 night it’s good, no showers (bucket), there is a shared bathroom. No a/c but there are fans. Simple bed, 2 in each room. It was 200c per person. Very safe parking with gate lock.

name: Hostel Salina
description: Very nice Hostel, nice pool, nice common aera with long chair and sofa, upstaire there is a bar and they make food, we paid 20$ per person in a dorm, but it was very clean, lots of people, hammoc... there is a guard in the parking during the night (and day too i think) good vibe, shuttle every day to the city and to the beach... wifi is the best i had in central america and suprisigly : HOT water in showers...

name: Smiles Coffee Calle Real
description:
cafe restaurant held by mute and deaf people. 
you choose out of photos the food you want to eat. 
not the best cuisine ever, but definitely a nice place to have a coffee or a juice. 

Smiles Coffee Calle Real Xalteva, junto Hotel Real Merced, Granada 43000, Nicaragua +505 8559 8315

name: El Peru - Camping in Restaurant/Bar Parking Lot
description: We parked on the big flat parking lot in front of the beach/river facing the volcano and with the other volcano behind us. You can take kayak tours too. We asked the owner Meel (?) to park our vehicle and he was very welcoming. We had a drink at the bar with Meel and asked if we can use the toilet and shower for the night which he gladly let us. Beautiful spot, didn't pay anything, good swimming spot! No wifi, lots of dogs around - Sasha the guard dog for security, and chickens.

name: La Casa de la Pradera
description: Had decent dinner here while staying at Casa San Jose next door. The place also offers rooms and secure parking. No info in hotel/hostal amenities. The restaurant is nice and clean with good wifi.

name: Matagalpa downtown
description: In the street, close to the cathedral and in front of Budget Rent. Security all the nigth. Not too noisy. Internet available: use Mokali cafe.

name: Suzuki
description: Motorcycle shop. Repairs and parts. These guys are great

name: Finca Forestal San Nicolás
description: Beautiful camping area amongst pine trees. Park on grass. A few palapas and fire cooking areas. One sink with running water. Bathrooms with paper but no seats. Cold showers. Short hiking trails. Just up the road is Don Alfonso Agua Termales. Paid $3.00usd per person.  Price now $10us or $325 Nicaraguan.

name: Termales Delia
description:
See latest note; 


Warm water swimming pools. Palapas. Restaurant. Paid 50c per person to swim and stay the night. Expected to buy a meal. We bought breakfast for 60c per person. Friendly people. Quiet night once the music went off.

name: Tourist info
description:
cigars factory that we could visit for free if you buy cigar.
you can get one for 3 dollars eacg

name: Museo de Historia y Arqueológia
description:
A small museum with information about the history of this area. $20C per person. 
Free WiFi in the park. A nice play area for kids. A big library. The stadium is across the street. Very nice area.

name: Café Las Flores (coffee production)
description:
This is a coffee production located in a really nice place. 
You need to park at the entrance and you will go to the production with a collective truck because the road is steep.
This is a guided tour of 1 hour when you see all the production process. Best season to visit is between November to January because it's the coffee picking and you will see the real process. Still really nice if you are not in those months. Everything is organic and sustainable and they show you why. About 14$ per person.

name: Parking for El Jalacate
description: Parking area for El Jalacate. Enter green gate. There are no signs or info. Follow “road” down hill. Pass through second green gate. Then watch for signs.

name: Puerto Las Brisas (Muelle San Jose del Sur)
description:
Other ferry option from San Jorge - Ometepe - San Jorge
Ferry "El Rey de Cocibolca"

Ferry schedule
San Jorge to Ometepe
09:30am
17:00pm

Ometepe to San Jorge
07:30am
15:00pm

We pay C$ 470 for our Land Rover Defender 110 + C$ 50pp. On the weekend recomended reserve.

I think is posible overnight there If you go to San Jorge at 07:30am.

From San Jorge to Ometepe (Moyogalpa) we pay C$ 500 + C$ 82,50 port fee + C$ 50pp on ferry Che Guevara (San Jorge to Moyogalpa).

name: Police control
description: They stopped us and tell us that we were in infraction because we drove on the left lane, but everybody did. So we explained that if we were in infraction, they have to stop every car, but then they let us go ... by the way, they checked our insurance that we took in Guatemala for Central America, and said it was perfect.

name: El Puerto
description: Best place to stay in San Juan del Sur. We looked in every place in the town to park our 24 ft RV but everything was too expensive and parking was at the street. This is the new harbour, and you have electricity, bathrooms (no shower), water and security 24 hrs for just 14 US.

name: Pietra magnifica, petroglifos
description: Pertoglific, some trails from the finca bring you to different site where you can admire petroglyphs

name: El buon ambiente
description:
Very good restaurant to stop before undertaking the Aduana mission!
Super clean, good food with a few vegetarian options! 
Clean toilets

name: Panadería Alemana
description:
Hidden treasure for all those who want more choices for bread/pastery than the usual you get. 
Price range is fair, might be a little bit more than what local bakeries (if you find one) take. But in return you get for example delicious, fresh croissants with ham and creme cheese for 50 Cordoba ($1,50/1,30€ at the moment). Considering that cheese and ham is quite expensive all over Central America (at least from my experience in supermarkets), decent price. Also offer bread, sweet pastery and what do I know - my eyes were glued to this croissant.

name: Managua
description: Behind the Uno station, electricity at the foot of a pole as soon as night falls. wifi from the supermarket of the station. Super nice employees. decent bathroom.

name: Parking lot. 30 Cordobas/day
description: Gated parking lot. 30 Cordobas per day. Big black metal gate. Guarded. Sign say closed from 12 to 2 pm. NO CAMPING. ***Actual gate is across from gps dot on iOverlander map***. There is a monthly parking price.

name: Old gate to volcano
description: Opposite old stone guard booth. Flat area for a 4x4 or two. Tent camping possible. Nice breeze. Free.

name: Ruamoko Hostel
description:
New Hostel near the beach. Dorms and camping space only. Private rooms not built yet. 

Good: Fully enclosed and secure. Big rigs no problem. Plenty of tent space. No A/C
No community kitchen, but they offer a group dinner for $6 ($5 for vegetarian)
Breakfast $4
Lunch $4 - 6
Dorms $12
Camping $5

Bad: Nothing yet. It's a party hostel. so it's it's not your thing....

name: beach point
description: in the end of the road, no people , quiet at night.

name: Badaboom Hostal & Surf
description: Great spot for both backpackers and overlanders alike. Cedric, the owner (speaks Spanish, French and English) allowed me to park my van under a large palapa giving me shade all day long $5USD per night. He provided me with electricity, good wifi that reached the van from the hostel and he allowed my dog to stay as well. They have a great bar and restaurant and are a 10 minute walk from The Boom. Really great surf spot. Highly recommended.

name: Museo precolombino de Chaguitillo
description: A small museum of precolumbian artifacts! Can also leave from here on a tour to the carvings.

name: Carne Asado Chayito
description: Great hot plate bbq joint. Fair prices. The beef tongue is great! Parking out front on street w/security.

name: Iniser Seguro
description:
In case you missed the car insurance at the border, you can get one here.
12 USD for 1 month. 1 month is minimum.
Car insurance is mandatory in Nicaragua.

name: Katy’s Hotel
description: Basic Hotel. Clean rooms with cold shower, toilet and sink. No AC but two fans in the room. There is lots of secure parking inside. There is room for big rigs in the parking area, but there may be an issue with height getting into the gate. Maybe 2.5 - 3 meters. Bar/Restaurant in the front of the Hotel with cheap drinks and Good food. Room cost 300 Córdoba for the night. Average meal is 150 Córdoba. Decent wifi works everywhere.

name: Water - Blue Doors
description:
You can buy the big 5 gallon jugs of water here. It was 126 C for two of them. 

You don't have to pay for the bottle (carafon) if you bring it back right away. 

They were open when we arrived at 7:45 am on a Saturday

Update 11/02/2023 : 80C per garrafon (20L)

name: Sand Flats near Playa Santana
description: Leveled spot on the sand flats near Playa Santana. No 4x4 needed. Only some motorbikes passing by in the evening and morning, other than that really quiet. Cool breeze in the evening, so not too many mosquitoes.  5 minutes walking to the beach.

name: Finca La Canavalia
description:
This is a cooperative eco-friendly farm from the community. They basically have everything: cacao, coffee, bananas, cattle, pigs, sheep...
We were recommended this place by a local. They  make a great tour around their Farm and explain you everything. It costs 100 cordobas per person.
They also asked us if we want to stay the night. we did not, so not sure about the price. They also offer food and some rooms.

This place is off the tourist grid and really nice and local. And the best thing: There are many sloths on the premises!!

We highly recommend this place!

name: Central Park w/ wifi
description: Central Park with free wifi. A little church too. Play structure for kids.

name: vulcanizadora (tires repair)
description: We had an issue with one tire of my f250 truck camper . got fixed and backup tire set in truck. good job. fair price

name: Pali Supermarket
description: Supermarket with clean bathrooms and t.p.

name: Congo beach
description:
Beautiful spot on the side of the road. Beach entrance to the lake, level-spot, some shade under wonderful trees and if you're lucky, pigs, dogs and monkeys will visit you during the day. 
And amazing sunset!

name: Taller Mechanic, Luis
description:
Asked a guy along the Panamerican for a mechanic because we were overheating since Honduras. He drove me over to this place where a mechanic came out and said he'd come by our hotel (Panamericano) to check things out. His name is Luis. I have his friend Gabriel's number for WhatsApp 50587301159. Did some diagnostics, added some coolant, went for a drive. Then we returned to this shop where they took out the radiator, drove it 30 km away to another town where it got cleaned (and they epoxied a hole), and returned and reinstalled it. Seemed professional and patient with my horrible Spanish. Gave us the number of a friend in Managua if we wanted to get a new/used radiator and told us to call him back if on our way to Esteli we broke down. A lot of guys in the shop but we left our van there all day and no issues. Cost for spending all day doing this was 2000C - seemed pretty cheap.
He's a Honda buff.

name: La vieja Managua
description: One of the first places in Central America that we are surprised by its deliciousness. we all know central american food is not great but this place is an exception. you pay for it (~$8-15) but it is worth the gastronomic satisfaction. Nothing incredibly fancy but good service and very good meats.

name: Hostal Colibrí
description:
Good hostel close to the cathedral and city center.

They offer dorms for 8 usd and rooms with shared bathroom for 22/23 usd (breakfast included)

They also offers laundry service for 6 usd, drinkable water and kitchen if you want to cook.

Moreover, they offers outdoor activities through a travel agency.

The place is quite clean and the space make you feel comfortable, also they have a small and beautiful garden where you can rest from the warm day (pay attention because you might can see hummingbirds)

name: Casa Huesped Vic-Pal
description:
Cheap place in Matagalpa, for 250 cordobas you have a private room with shared bathroom and 400 córdobas with private bathroom.

They also have dorms but I don't know they exact price.

They offers breakfast for 70 cordobas.

The place is quite clean and comfortable, perfect for backpackers.

name: La Vita e Bella
description: Delicious pizza and pasta in the cozy restaurant. Street parking available.

name: El Parqueo de Teresa
description: In the middle of the Bay, much quieter than Popoyo, Less than tourists here and especially less expensive. Small parking on the edge of the beach. Unpretentious in the heart of a fishing village. Field padlocked in the evening, no worries of insecurity for us. Family Teresa organizes trips at sea for surfing and fishing. there is a tap freshwater and shower outside (with moderation, lack of water here). It is possible to buy fresh fish with the fishermen when they return from fishing in the morning. Price for a night on this simple parking 100 cordobas after negotiation with the owners.

name: Hotel Internacional
description:
One room with one/two beds and shared bathroom for 200 Cordobas and private room with private bathroom for 300 Cordobas.

The normal room was unclean and the shared bathroom was also the same, besides the smell of cigarettes and not comfortable bed.

But the private room was quite clean and pretty good so I suggest to the travelers to spend 100 cordobas more and get a good room (If you feel that you want to get quality and comfortable bed)

name: Museo de Leyendas y Tradiciones
description: A clever museum combining some history, folklore and prison information. Housed in a prison known for torture it has displays and information in English and Spanish. $50C per person. Well worth the time.

name: Rivas plaza
description:
Ok to stay here , safe . Closed to basketball ground , a parking front of pkayground. A lot of restaurants , fast wifi in the park , water and WC.
Cool free place . Ok for our big 24 feet RV

name: Apoyo Lodge
description: We stayed here for Easter - yoga vegan retreat by the lake. Free yoga class So in morning at 7pm and delicious vegetarian food for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Run by a spanish couple. Great company with mostly young professionals needing time out - 20-40 year olds guests. Only downside is the road here - don’t attempt unless you have a 4v4. The roads are more like rough rocky beach tracks with tire puncher stones and pot holes! Also tiny width roads and trees so can have issues with high clearance if over 7feet high and traffic jams when cars try to pass. Beautiful part of the world otherwise!

name: Hotel el Pantano
description:
ADMIN NOTE: please be aware that this place has been submitted by a stakeholder of the place.

Hotel  el Pantano offers clean and comfortable rooms for individual travelers, families and groups.

We are not the “standard” Nicaraguan hotel because our location in a green area of 8.7 acres  just at the edge of town makes you feel being in nature itself!

But it’s not “exclusively rooms and food” we strive to offer you, we also care for your complete holiday experience! We know that you want to get to know the area, the people and the most interesting places to visit. That’s why we included a section called “Places To Visit” for you to plan and decide what to do during your stay with us. And if you need some help with information or arrangements you can count on our staff to help you as best as we can!

name: Managua International Airport
description: Here's the deal for flying out of this airport and leaving your vehicle long term.  The airport charges 150 cordobas per night to park.  Parking is directly in front of the airport.  Completely hassle free although Tuesdays and Thursdays the parking lot closes at 1030pm (if you fly in after that suspect you can just sleep in the camper).  All other days it closes at 2am.  Opens at 5am.  We are not sure if they would hassle you to actually sleep in your camper in the lot so we slept at an Puma gas station just down the road with a truck stop area at the back (bring earplugs).  Super convenient, 24 hr guard for 50 cordobas.  The alternative is the Best Western directly across from the airport (you can just walk across the road to and from).  They wanted you to book a room at approx us$95 and then will charge us$7 per night to park.  The airport itself is really nice and very small.  TONS of souvenirs to buy if you need to (beautifully set out in a market type atmosphere).  There is a departure tax of us$35 but ours was included in our ticket).  On our return (ticket one way into Nicaragua) they did not need to see a flight or bus ticket out of Nicaragua.

name: Puma
description: We stayed here the night before flying out of Managua international airport.  Truck stop at the back.  Earplugs necessary but 2 minutes to the parking at the airport.  24 hr guard - 50 cordobas / night.  Has a Super 7 onsite.

name: Hostel Edelma
description:
Private rooms with private bathroom from 8 dollars.

The rooms have three beds so the price could change depending on guests 

The family who runs the hostel is extremely friendly, they will provide you with info about the island, tours and guides, they also provide bicycles and motorcycles for rent.

If you want, they also offers breakfast for 4 dollars

name: Hostel Esperanza
description: They let you park in front of the hostel with access to showers and bathroom as well as internet for 5$ per night. Breakfast not included by i think you can negotiate. I didn't and paid 50 cordoba for breakfast (fruits, egg, gallo pinto). Internet wifi is Turbonett C38654

name: Villa de San Fernando
description: Hostal lindo, con habitaciones grandes, ventilador, aire acondicionado, baño privado. Wifi, amplio parqueadero.

name: Hotel kencho
description:
Good hotel close to the park in Altagracia, the rooms costs 400 cordobas or probably more but we got private room with private bathroom for 200 cordobas.

The room was clean and comfortable, but as this is an island with jungle be ready to see a lot of ants XD

The hotel has a restaurant with good prices and good food.

They also can communicate with a guide if you want to do the volcanos.

I am not sure but I guess they also rent bikes and motorcycles.

name: Cada Ivana
description: It is okay to park motorcycle inside in the lobby; very cheap dorm room

name: Iniser Seguro
description: Insurance for Nicaragua. $12. Incase you missed it at the border like us. Nicaragua requires auto insurance.

name: Street camping
description:
In front of the queen lobster restaurant, a place to park and sleep for one night. Lot of little mosquitoes. As a street parking, people start to make noise early. OK for one night but we are looking for an other place to stay one more night...
WiFi from restaurant available.
Access to the toilets too.

name: Parque Central
description: Good Free Wifi in the Central park. No password needed.

name: Queen Lobster
description: Nice view and good place to stay in. They also have a restaurant and serve a delicious lobster with Coco cream. Wi-Fi available.

name: Awas
description: We parked in Guillermo's field for one night. We joined friends who spent 3 nights here without trouble. We had a great time and a warm welcome from Guillermo and his family. We highly recommend this place which is the best solution to park in Laguna perla (otherwise it's street parking). The access road is narrow but no problem with our 7m long. We had some flexible branches on the roof on the way to get there (3m high) but nothing terrible.

name: Get up stand up clothes
description: Clothes made behind the shop with recycled material. Really nice clothes, hats and swimsuit. They also offer surf lessons and a beach shuttle to Las Peñitas

name: AutoNica Toyota
description: They have extremely knowledgeable staff and VERY expensive but original Toyota's parts.

name: Bodega Automotriz
description: We bought here suspension parts for Toyota 4Runner'04: bushings, ball joints, terminal links, also air filter and wipers. Prices are much better than in AutoNica (also in iOverlander), but some parts are not original. They made a small discount for us. Open hours: 8-17 Monday-Friday, 8-12.30 Saturday

name: Passed the fortaleza coyotepe road
description: Policeman stopped me because i changed lane on a solid line. Indeed this is extremely tricky: there are 2 lanes and if you drive on the right lane then suddenly it goes off the main road to the fortress, without any warning signs. So you get on the left lane and bam! Policeman right after. Wanted to give me a 25$ ticket, I should have handled him a fake driving licence so he wouldnt threat of keeping it.

name: Cerrajeria Alvarado
description: Oscar Alvarado can copy almost any key you need. He did a good job for us as all our spare keys of the Campervan had been stolen in Costa Rica.

name: Lakefront Sunset View Complete with Cows and Roosters
description: At the end of a decently rough road there is a large flat open area to camp. We asked a few of the locals who were doing laundry and herding their livestock they said of course. There are a few palapa for shade and a few big trees. We saw lightning bugs and cane toads when it got dark. Great sunset view over Mombacho volcano.

name: Ida Hostal Managua
description: The only good thing about this hostel is that they have private parking but just for one car. Other than that the owners are very nice but this hostel is so dirty... Lots of cockroaches, dirty sheets with stains and holes, if you stay a few nights they never come to clean your room nor empty the trash can in your room. 1 bed in dormitory costs 10$. Private room for 25$ negociable. Pay extra for A/C. Good wifi. Pet friendly

name: Beach camp
description: We camped a few nights on this sandy beach. A few locals fishing doing laundry and tending horses cows and pigs. Bought fish from the fisherman. Sand is soft and we had to use Maxx tracks sand boards to get off the beach in our 2wd Vanagon. Should be no problem for 4wd. Quiet secluded beach camp site BUT UNREACHABLE DURING RAINY SEASON

name: Hotel Villa Paraiso
description: We parked for a night outside this hotel, next to the ATM. Asked the security guard and had no problem. Free.

name: Hospedaje Central
description:
We were allowed to camp on their (gated) parkinglot/mutual garden for $3,50 per person. The vibe is a bit hippy, but really nice. Owner (French Canadian) is super friendly. 
They allowed our dog, but they have 2 dogs themselves and they were not sure how they were gonna react on other dogs. (But the dogs were fine with our dogs)
Food was good. The toilets were fine, but we didn’t use the shower, so no comments about that. 
Wifi was really slow, they said that there was something wrong and the whole town had bad wifi atm, but we were not sure if that was true. 

(There will fit two to three small vans and pnly one big rig)

name: Hotel y Cabinas Leiko
description: Good Hotel for staying the night after crossing the border. 20 usd for one person in private room with shared bathroom (24 usd for two persons). Safe parking and nice owner. Great breakfast included.

name: La Frontera
description:
Very nice place to eat burgers. Try the vegetarian options. Burgers are huge and delicious.
Toña for 40 cordobas, cheapest place we have ever seen (except for market).
Burgers starts at 210, burritos, quesadilha 210...

Opens wed-sunday from 12 until 8 pm

name: Parking lot of Hotel Monkey Hut
description: Parking lot infront of Hotel monkey hut. 30 C for a day. Owner not there so we pay Nothing. Possible to stay the day at the Beach of Hotel monkey Hut. 6 US per Person inkl. Bathrooms, kayak 1 Hour and hammocks. Very nice for one day Hanging arround. Not cheap but ok.

name: Salto Estanzuela
description: Nice and refreshing waterfall, we payed 30 cdb entrance per person, a 4x4 track leads down but you can also park at the entrance and walk 0,5 km to the fall. Camping is possible, there is a pit toilet and gated parking area, big rigs no problem.

name: Casa Guirila- Parqueo y Camping
description: Gated parking area in a small organic farm. Entrance is at Casa de Guerila, a tasty sweet corn with cheese sort of thick tortilla. A few kms from lagoon and the family was very friendly. Water available and good kitchen, cold showers and toilet. 5usd per person. Also saw a bit of space for camping. Small shops or pulperias for tortillas etc Other local food can be ordered from restaurant tho not in menu

name: Kajak Rental
description:
Kayak rental. 15.- USD per person for the whole day. 30.- for a double.
It's possible to camp in front of the lake for free. Really nice spot.

name: Telares La Fé Weaving
description:
This is a little family owned weaving company who produces beautiful cotton fabrics, blankets, towels, scarves, dish wear. 
Lovely people who proudly show their production in the back yard. It is one block over from iOverlander location

name: Managua Hills B&B
description: A true oasis in the city of Managua with secure parking, a pool, good free breakfast, nice rooms, free drinking water and relaxing peaceful garden space. Not a place to sleep in your car, but an amazing option to stay in the city and have a safe place to park your vehicle on-site. Walking distance to restaurants, a weekend farmers market and a food-cart pod (only 2 blocks away!) with a variety of food, ice cream and live entertainment on weekends. Very safe neighborhood, felt safe walking to/from dinner at night. Rooms with private bathroom $40. Gate has height restriction of about 7.5 ft (2.5m) or so. We fit with our small camper and surfboards on top, but big rigs would not fit.

name: Hotel Roca de la Cumbre
description: Quaint little Hotel in Matagalpa , small pool private courtyard and terrace overlooking city. AC hot water secure parking, very accommodating staff and owner, parked our motorcycle in the fenced lot beside hotel, very secure. Not big rig friendly, as lot has gate with top an is only big enough for about 8 cars. Rooms are around 30$ us two people. Owner upgraded us for free to a king size bed! What A Treat!

name: Lorena surf hostel
description: This hostel is amazing! Super cozy, free breakfast and an awesome owner. Last but not least, surfboards included in price! Not a party hostel, really nice and quiet. The owner, Chelo, is going to start camping facilities for overlanders soon. Get in touch with him if you are interested in camping! +505 84262267 or just go to the hostel and ask for Chelo.

name: Hotel Sharlot
description: We asked to stay on their Parkinglot for the Night because it gets dark. First they wanted 10$ (US) but at the the end we paied 5$. They had toilets and a wifi working at the restaurant and by the gate too. Our friends with a car stayed in a tent and also payed 5$. Ok place to stay one night.

name: Close to the beach
description:
Very quiet at night and day. No facilities. Surf. Tortugas rescues a few meters at the beach. Beautiful sunset. Very hot. Ok for big rig. One of the only place you can park. 
The neighbor is from California. He provided us electricity and shower.

name: Personnalise tour in French cheaper than agency
description:
Lester is a Nicaraguan guide who speaks very good French. He lived in the north not Calais for 2 years. We met him at the Free City Tower near the cathedral. Very good tour by the way. He is passionate about Leon and volcanoes.
It offers other customized tours cheaper than agencies such as for example sledding of the cerro negro, night under tent Telica volcano, ...
We highly recommend it.
Its whatsapp: 005057814 - 4740

Lester est un guide nicaraguayen qui parle très bien français. Il a vécu dans le nord pas de calais pendant 2 ans. Nous l’avons rencontré au Free city tour près de la cathédrale. Très bon tour d’ailleurs. Il est passionné de Léon et des volcans. 
Il propose d’autres tours personnalisés moins cher que les agences comme par exemple descente en luge du cerro negro, nuit sous tente au volcan Telica,... 
Nous le recommandons vivement. 
Ses whatsapp : 005057814 - 4740

name: Hostal Tipico
description:
Carlos is a very nice guide to visit Miraflores. His family and he are very nice. His wife is an excellent cook and cooks with their organic vegetables. The accommodation is simple but very quiet. 
It costs 17$ for one night with three meals. 10$ for the kids but you can negotiate. 
You can also have a tour for one day. It’s 20$ pp. the tour is very interesting and includes breakfast and lunch. He knows a lot of things. Very nice area Miraflores. 
For us, he used one horse for our two little kids and it was free. 
We took the bus from Esteli in the morning and back in the afternoon. 
It’s the son's WhatsApp.

name: Jardines Del Paraiso
description: This lovely couple let us park for free ($10 a night for two, 2022) at their hotel and use their wifi, bathrooms and shower.  We ate and had a few beers at their little food truck and they were more than happy.  Very relaxed vibes

name: Restaurante El Típico
description:
We asked the guy who was offering the menu on the beach if we could stay overnight. It was OK.
We parked right beside the restaurant in the shade, in front of the lake. 
Good view, nice and windy spot to make a little stop before or after crossing Costa Rica. 
The servers sleep there. 
Restroom is closed at night. 

(We had the local fish “guapote”cooked “al vapor al ajillo” this was made to order, but recommendable instead of the fried version, medium size is 300.

name: Playa El Remanso
description:
Parked for 2 nights right on the beach between the two bars that also rent surf boards. They close early and both had friendly security guys there all night that let us use the toilets. Wifi available at the bar on the left, but they are hesitant to give out the password. 
Good surf at Remanso but probably better a 15 minute walk south to Playa El Tamarindo. Access road is a little rough but no 4x4 or high clearance required. Great spot to get away from noisy San Juan and be first in the water in the morning.

name: Soldando / Welder
description: No sign, No name but a local guy took us here. Good & cheap for body repairs.

name: UNO gaz station
description: Small gaz station, no security but the guys that are working there stay all the night. They told us that we don't need to pay but they wanted something like a tip or a soda. We gave some cakes and a big bottle of coca-cola. Nice guys but a lot of noise in the morning. Good Asado in front of the  station, very tasty meat!

name: Multicentro Estelí (Wifi Gratis)
description:
Free parking and security. It has a covered terrace with tables and chairs. You just put the mate and go! (or buy a coffee) 

Free Wifi
Estacionamiento gratis y seguridad. Tiene una terraza cubierta con mesas y sillas. Vos solo poné el mate y listo! (o comprate un café )

name: Hotel El Cortijo Luna
description: New hotel, only 8 months old. Very reasonable prices. We payed 11US for a spacious room with private bathroom and shower. Rooms with AC and breakfast included for a little extra. The owner Carlos is working on his “eco lodge” style accommodations, and will soon have a camping area. There is an affordable restaurant on site. He has some animals, and it is a nice nature setting. Great stop before or after the border to Costa Rica.

name: Mr. Seafood
description:
seafood shop / restaurant alongside the PanAmerican highway. We stopped after seeing their sign from the road, to buy fish to cook at dinner, and realizing they were also a restaurant in the back, ended up staying for lunch.
the seafood is really cheap at the shop. restaurant a bit more pricey, but delicious. Huge tuna steak with grilled veggies for 10$, 2 lobster tails diffrent style for 15$. great service, parking alongside the restaurant, away from the street, where you can keep an eye on your vehicle.

name: El Aguila Mofles and Parking
description:
Big Parking compound. Fenced with a muffler shop in the front, a lot of roofed monthly parking spots and a green patch in the back.
Stayed over night for a muffler fabrication. 
The owner "Wilber" is a nice guy.  Safe spot with high fence and wall, gate closes at 11pm, night guard.
Close to the center, cheap and even has some simple facilities. The owner and night guard is a lovely guy, as well as the persons that are there during the day. the toilet door was broken so there is a piece of metal you can put It front, no flush. Shower didn't work but you can take a bucket and fill it with water. We washed ourselves at night and use the water during the day too cool ourselves (Léon is HOT these months).

name: El Garaje
description:
Amazing food! Paul and Heather (Canadians) own the restaurant and everything is freshly made in a farm to table style! Their menu selection should satisfy all eaters! We tried the Tandoori chicken pita and Indian chickpea pita. Both came with a side salad and were amazing! We added a picture of their menu and they always have new weekly specials. Really cute interior, with art work and chill atmosphere. 
Most prices around 165 Córdoba.
Monday through Friday only. (Closed Sat. Sun)
11:30AM-3:30PM

name: Police stop
description: Police checkpoint. Asked to see passports. No problem

name: Volcano Hostel
description: Very nice place!!! Cheap and good location. Great breakfast.

name: Taller Mingo
description: Great mechanic with tons of off-road vehicle experience. Located centrally in Chinandega

name: 'el recreativo' free tent camp
description:
This is the community building where they have activities etc. Big roof to camp under. Closed. So you can leave and walk around town. Next to square. 

Electricity plug available.

Toilets. 

I 'showered' using a plastic bottle. Neughbours can't see you. 

Seems like Manuel, the man in charge, lives next door with his family. 

Perfect spot! (on bicycle)

name: Garden Grove
description: Great place to relax for a couple of days. Quiet and a 30second walk to the beach. 2 large rooms with shared kitchen, shower, toilet and 3 self contained units. Cost in off season October 25 for 2 nights in shared rooms and 30 for self contained. Plenty of space and peaceful, the beach is a bit rough to swim but great surf

name: Hostal Hato Nuevo Reserva Ecológica
description:
Hato Nuevo is an Ecolodge offering mountains views, horseback ridings, hammocks, gardens, Tour guide to visit Cosiguina volcano, etc is a peacefull and joyfull place to be in touch with nature 
it also  offers delicious food at the hotel restaurant

name: on the beach "the boom"
description: Right in front of the wave, on the sand we drove into the beach from the road where rise up surf camp is. We haven't had any problems, 4x4 and air down needed. Awesome place

name: Parqueo Bomberos
description:
Overnight is allowed.
Secure parking lot, which belongs to the fire stacion of Matagalpa. Cost C$ 20.00/day. We don't know if the overnight stay is allowed. Pls ask a very friendly staff.

name: Free camping on the beach
description: At the end of the beach front road there is a free lot with couple lanchas (boats) and trees. We asked local business owners and security guard at the house in front and all said it was safe, free and ok to sleep there. Annoying sandflies though...

name: Wild Wave surf house
description:
Wild Wave rooms. This is such a nice nice and clean place. 3-4 different rooms from 18$-40$. Shared kitchen. Fridge. WiFi & water. Very nice rooms & Gianni (the Italian owner) is very friendly and knows lots of people, he is also a very good surfer and knows all the places and when to go. he let us sleep with our Jeep in his garden behind the house. We knew him from 5 years ago and just wrote him on facebook one day before if he could find us a place for our Jeep. We highly recommend this place. Also our dog was welcome. 
His friend has an official campsite down the street so maybe he will send you to there. 

Name is wild Wave surfhouse on facebook. 

In popoyo there might also cross a dog with 3 leg’s your way. It’s RON, a grey Pitbull and he is just so cool. Give him a hug or some food or go with him on the beach. He manage walking with 2 legs so good and he is always happy. 🐕

name: Comedor Panchita
description: Small comedor with a bunch of different options. For lunch, you can choose one of two options of the day. We had a plate of ribs with rice, salad and platanos for 75 cordobas and it was delicious!

name: Finca El Socorro
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Description provided by owner.

Third Generation coffee farm/dairy operation, stunning views, 2.5km from matagalpa. Amazing camp spots, natural spring water available (we drink it). Breakfast could be arranged upon request, tours of the coffee plantation and diary operation. 8 USD per vehicle per night. Fair cell phone and data reception. Please call Edgar Arguello at +505 86457638 or Sara Rodrigues at +505 8359 8439 for information.

name: ProBar
description: Cheap and delicious meals in a form of a buffet. You can choose from a variety of different ingriedients. We paid 60 cordobas for a dish made of a chicken, rice, pasta, side salad and platanitos + a drink. It was a home-made food, super tasty!

name: Comedor Camila
description: A food street stall that opens around 5/6pm. Tasty and very cheap food. You can try a variety of different options for around 15 cordobas or a dish made of meat, rice and beans, salad and tortilla for 70 cordobas. Very nice ladies :) There's not a lot place to sit but it works perfect for takeaway.

name: Puma
description:
Gas station at the entrance of Leon, we found quiet during the day and asked to sleep the night and they left us. We were accompanied by one more traveler. The night was quiet and safe. We paid nothing, got drinking water and toilets.
--
Posto de gasolina na entrada de León, achamos tranquilo durante o dia e pedimos para dormir a noite e eles nos deixaram. Estávamos acompanhados de mais um viajante. A noite foi tranquila e segura. Não pagamos nada, tem água potável e banheiros.

name: Entrada al Volcan Masaya
description: We asked the guard if we could sleep there, he said yes, he offered us water and sanitary facilities, if needed. so it's fine for one night and then you enter the volcano.  Free!

name: La Vista Restaurante
description:
Small hotel and restaurant, very friendly people, great food and service. 
For 10 USD per car they let us park our campers in the gated parking lot with security. Best place to stay when you want to visit the world famous Flor de Caña distillery and don’t want to drive tipsy afterwards. The distillery is in walking distance (ca. 1km). The place is open from thursday to sunday from midday till 10pm.

name: Centro Recreativo Pereira Mendoza
description:
Water park, cabanas, hotel, and safe gated enclosed parking lot. Run by a very nice family with a sweet daughter who loves helping set up tents.

They let me tent camp in the yard and park my motorcycle overnight for free with ludicrously cheap admission to the water park (50/adult, 30?/child).

HUGE parking lot can fit any rig. Restrooms are ok. Outdoor cold shower. Swimming pools! Honestly can't remember if they had internet or not, since I didn't ask.

The father watched TV until about 11pm, so if you're a light sleeper I'd recommend camping on the other end of the parking lot, away from the main building.

By far the cheapest camping option near the Gausaule border crossing!

name: Volcano Day Tours- volcano sandboarding tour
description: Highly recommend this tour company if you want to try sandboarding a volcano!! $30US includes 1 hr transportation to volcano (can’t drive there yourself), 45 min hike up volcano, gear and board (sitting or standing board) to board down, watermelon at bottom of volcano, a free beer back in the city, AND a free tank top and stickers!! Wilbur was a phenomenal tour guide who speaks Spanish and English and is very friendly and accommodating and who takes awesome pics and videos for you!! We showed up late after the first tour left and they still took us up on our own for same price!!

name: Hostal Fachente
description:
We stayed here for a night and we felt very good. The dorm was for 6 $ per person. They have billiard and it's very quiet and next to the centre of Leon. We had the dorm only for us and each bed has his own fan. The breakfast was included and incredible delicious! 

We can highly recommend to stay in this hostel.

name: Granada Boutique Hotel
description: Lovely pool and spacious rooms, parked on street and tipped Leo the night watchman to watch the car. Staff very friendly.  Close to central square and restaurants. We felt very comfortable here.

name: Finca Popoyo
description: Bar/restaurant at the parking lot for the Popoyo break with a beautiful view overlooking the surf. They allowed us to park our van for a couple of nights. 10per night for 2 ppl. Bathrooms and showers available but very rustic.

name: Gilberto / Nick’s Place
description:
We stayed with the LOVELY Gilberto and his family in one of the three rooms he’s got available. He charged us $20 a night which isn’t cheap generally but is in this area which has some other really expensive hotels! You can pay an extra $5 for an air con room and I kind of wish we did because it was very hot - the rooms are also concrete brick.

He’s got a swimming pool that we were welcome to use and his lovely wife cooked us a great fish meal too.

It’s got a high grey concrete wall around the yard and has La Privicidad painted on the large gate. It’s next to a house entrance with a colourful sign for Hawaii. We found Gilberto’s house on Google listed as Nick’s place and contacted him through this before.

name: Hotel California
description:
Nice hotel with clean spacious rooms with private bathroom and secure parking (maybe not for big rigs, height restriction about 2,5m). It has a nice pool in the courtyard and breakfast is included. A double room was 40 USD, but we could bargain him down to 30 USD.
They also offer laundry service (50 cord for 12 pieces).
It seemed to be the meeting point of the LGBT community and has a bar. Music stopped at about 10pm.
It's about ten minutes walking into the centre.

name: Hotel Julieta
description: Interesting little hotel/hostel. Private rooms and shared rooms with shared bathroom and shower. Single room 9usd and double room 14usd. Julieta is super nice and speaks a little English. Mike is an American and a very interesting man. There is no parking here. We locked our motos up on the front patio. It would be great for cyclists, not so much for larger vehicles

name: Lago de Masaya
description: Wild camping next to Lake Masaya. Accessible by a 4x4 trail of lava and sand, pretty decent track. Enough flat spaces on various side tracks which are not in any mapping app. We drove here with two motorcycles and camped 3m from the lake! Really quit during night and we were the only ones. Good option before/after visiting Masaya Vulcan as it is not next to the noisy highway but only 15min away!

name: Base camp Vulcan telica
description: There is a mini base camp here with a firepit, some trees and walls to protect you from wind. We stayed one night, quit and easy accessible by foot. Just an hour hike from the end of the road (see other instructions on how to get there). No facilities but beautiful to watch sunset and sunrise

name: Hotel Vizcaino
description:
Hotel in the centre of Matagalpa, in walking distance to everything.
Single room with private bathroom, cable TV and fan for 15 USD (breakfast included).
Secure gated parking inside the property.

name: Hotel Marbella
description:
Room for one person with fan, cable TV and bathroom for 250 cordobas (breakfast included).
Gated parking for cars.
Several other accomodation options in the town of Waslala.

name: Hostal Cola Blanca
description: Simple but clean little hotel in Bonanza. Room with fan, bathroom and TV for 300 cordobas. Gated parking for vehicles.

name: Hotelito Boca de la Montana
description:
I decided to sleep here because I found it too hot at the seaside and I did not find on the beaches near San Juan del Sur a campsite that I liked.
This Hotelito is a motel with a nice grassy lawn. I inquired about the price of the rooms and I was told 35 USD, which quickly went down to 500 cordobas when I protested about the expensive price. 
Having seen the nice lawn I asked if it was possible to sleep in the car and use the restroom only, for 5 USD. 
They agreed!

name: Ceramica Negra
description:
Cooperative wich produce ceramica negra, See the Workshop and nice guys.  Reasonable

don't listen to Google maps, it's right of the main road.

name: Lakeside
description: Cute spot by the lake. Entry height is limited at 3.7 mtrs. Exit from main road is marked by a blue malecon sign. Directly on the lake. Some friendly people around.

name: Casa del francès
description:
House of a Franco-Nicaraguan family.
You can park your camper in front of their house. There is shower toilet wash water electricity.
They are very hospitable. Patrice the owner is a gold miner and will share with you his passion.
His wife Iliana can offer you very good meals, typical of Nicaragua.
There is a river 100 meters from the house where you could cool off.
Possibility to wash the linen (service by hand) made by the sister sister 50 Nio the 12 piece.
$ 10 per night with all services
You will camp in the garden of the house possibility to return 1 or 2 big campers but Patrice can find you a place with his family if there is more place next door.
Call +505 86778437
Whatsapp: 0033 6 49 17 65 54
-------
Maison d une famille franco nicaraguayen.
Vous pouvez garer votre campeur devant leur maison. Il y a douche toilette lavoir eau électricité.
Il sont très accueillants. Patrice le propriétaire est orpailleur et partagera avec vous sa passion.
Son épouse Iliana peut vous proposer des repas très bon, typique du Nicaragua. 
Il y a une rivière à 100 mètre de la maison où vous pourrait vous rafraîchir.
Possibilité de laver le linge ( service à la main ) fait par la belle sœur 50 Nio les 12 pièce. 
10$ la nuit avec tous les services.
Vous camperez dans le jardin de la maison possibilité de rentrer 1 ou 2 gros campeurs mais Patrice peut vous trouver une place chez sa belle famille s il n y a plus place juste à côté .
Appelez le au +505 86778437
Whatsapp: 0033 6 49 17 65 54 
-------

Casa de una familia franco-nicaragüense.
Puedes estacionar tu camper frente a su casa. Hay ducha inodoro lavado agua electricidad.
Son muy hospitalarios. Patrice el propietario es un buscador de oro y compartirá con usted su pasión.
Su esposa Iliana puede ofrecerte muy buenas comidas, típicas de Nicaragua.
Hay un río a 100 metros de la casa donde podría refrescarse.
Posibilidad de lavar la ropa (servicio a mano) hecha por la hermana hermana 50 Nio la 12 pieza.
$ 10 por noche con todos los servicios.
Usted acampará en el jardín de la casa posibilidad de regresar 1 o 2 campistas grandes, pero Patrice puede encontrarle un lugar con su familia si hay más lugares al lado.
Llame al +505 86778437
Whatsapp: 0033 6 49 17 65 54

name: Canopy Tour Miravalle
description:
We spent the night here. It's a tourist business. 11 lines zip line tour (Canopy),  3 different hikes to Mombacho Volcano (cráter, tigrillo y puma). Mauricio (+505 8872 2555) the owner welcome everyone to stay here for free and the time you want! and also has ton of space for every size (owns two other sites around). They also have Coffee and birds tours. Cacao plantation too. Everyone speaks English. We even saw monkeys from the Zipline! Right now the place is on the left of the road until they finish the restaurant on the right (May 2019) where they'll have showers and wifi. 
Don't leave here without a long chat with Mauricio about the recent history of Nicaragua!!

name: Leo’s Tours
description: Tree Office - Leo’s Tours operate in the street, under a tree. You can easily find him because he has bicycles for rent. We booked a Masaya Volcano night tour (US$20 each) and an Isletas boat tour (US$20 each) with him. He is extremely professional and friendly. His tour company is a cooperative which only uses local drivers and boat owners. We are travelling on a motorbike and it was nice to be tourists for a while.

name: Antorchas
description: This place is great really cool vibe Friday night chill. Must try the tostonburgueses.  So good and we brought our dog in. I mean we have a cool dog that is practically a celebrity down here, but still!! So don’t be cheap try your Spanish on some local hot nicas enjoy

name: Parking Mombacho Volcan
description: This is the parking area before trekking the Mombacho volcano. the security told us it was fine staying overnight for free. it has toilets but no showers. Beautiful place to stay.

name: Parking Restaurant Las Chelas
description:
we stayed here a couple of nights. We gave the security guy 50 Cordobas per night. The parking is opposite to the restaurant Las Chelas, you need to try the ceviche and tostones. Local place so quite cheap.
this is a parking lot so no toilets or energy plugs but you can get the WiFi from the restaurant.
The parking lot also belongs to a news channel, every body was very nice to us and helpful as we had done mechanical issues.

Sitio tranquilo para pasar la noche. pagamos unos 50 Cordobas al guarda de seguridad por noche. Está enfrente del restaurante las chelas donde puedes coger Internet y tomar unos ceviches buenísimos!

name: Uno Gas Station
description: we parked overnight once. it's for free and security 24/7. Nice people! you also have the shop, electricity, toilets and WiFi.

name: Hotel La Gran Sultana
description: What an unexpected surprise. The tour guide set us up here. My wife and 8 children. Two clean, air conditioned rooms, with warm showers and beautiful pool, for only $65.00. For 2 or 3 dollars more you could add breakfast. Price depends on what breakfast you choose. There was a balcony on the roof with beautiful view. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful. Don’t let the exterior fool you, I drove right past it, had to go around the block to get back to it. It was two blocks from the central plaza, and half a block from the local street market. Horse carriages, and taxis readily available if needed right out the front door. They had a private, locked parking area on what looked like a private home property a block away. We drive a 15 passenger van, with a car topper, and that fit, but I’m not sure how larger rigs might fit. The hotel was absolutely beautiful. A very refreshing reprieve after days of hot camping. We were told it has only been open for 2 years.

name: parador latino
description: Parador Latino offers restaurant service, swimming pool, safe parking with fresh environment, potable water, sanitary services, green areas ... we are waiting for you

name: The Blue Cafe
description: Nice little cafe close to the main square. Best gallopinto I’ve had in Nicaragua and fantastic banana pancakes. Prices are reasonable and the staff are very friendly.

name: Taller Vallejos
description:
Workshop for 4x4 cars, mainly Landcruisers. We found the place through a recommendation from an American who owns a couple of Landcruiser and used to live here.
The owner Valleos and his son Xavier are friendly and very knowledgeable, although they only speak spanish. He is also the chief of the local 4x4 club here in Estelí.
They rebuilt the knuckles of our Landcruiser, changed the diesel filter and the diff oil plus did a whole bunch of minor things in one day. Parts for Landcruisers are also available in town obviously.
Would recommend the shop to do maintenance and/or just to check your Landcruiser by guys who know what they’re doing.

name: Sunsets villa restaurant
description: We came here for lunch we order the nachos in the vegetarian taco tacos the nachos came with a bunch of lettuce on it and some stuff that was supposed to be chicken but I’m not really sure if it was even chicken so I’ll be careful coming here also we ordered me Chelada us and they charge us two dollars for a shot of tomato juice and in addition to the price of the Michelada not a good value super slow service

name: Turn off to Cerro Negro Volcano
description:
Would not recommend using this entry point, you can take a paved / brick road a few kilometers further south instead (turns into dirt closer to Cerro Negro).

This is the turn off from NIC-12 where one of the main tracks to Cerro Negro starts. 
Maps.me/OSM are not working so just follow the dirt road (rough in the beginning until you left Leon) and in case you get lost ask any local they know how to get there.
See also our description on the iOverlander spot Cerro Negro

name: El Primo
description:
Local food restaurant by Ulices Guido and his family. Cell phone: 89575522

There is also a small shop for beverages.

Ulices also has a starting campsite (started since sep 2018) 
We did put the campsite on iOverlander as well. It’s about 1500m from this restaurant. 

To find this place: It’s circa 150m from the main (dirt) road into the small village, straight on the right side beside the school.

name: Gaby’s Laundry
description:
Lavanderia in San Juan, 
It’s probably more expensive than in any other city.

name: Centro Recreativo El Primo
description:
2022 update: The restaurant is closed but the campsite is still open, just send a WhatsApp message a day in advance. You can camp for free!

Ulices Guido is running this place since Sep 2018. Contact him via 89575522 or go to his restaurant, about 1500m from here to contact him. He is not at the campsite (See on iOverlander, El Primo Restaurant, close by).
It’s a nice place but very basic in rural area.
Shelter for hammocks, running water, tent field, space enough for big rigs.
The place is along a dirt road which easily can be ridden with two-wheel drive. Cyclists; be aware for some pushing instead of cycling. 
We stayed two days and hiked to the crater of the Telica Volcano. Awesome place!!

name: Taller Lurma
description:
Workshop in Leon for Toyota Landcruisers.
The owner Carlos is friendly & knowledgeable, probably not the cheapest because he‘s used to working for Europeans.
He has had his shop for almost 10 years now and before that he worked for the local Toyota dealer so he has good connections to get genuine parts.

name: nice parqueo by the beach
description: We stayed here for 3 nigths with our van. The place is a parqueo with beach acces for 50 cordobas. Have shade until 11 pm, no water in the place but if you speak with the owner, Efren, you can fill your deposit in his family restaurant 500 meters away. No realy clean but for this price a good place to stay. Very recomended!!

name: Hotel Jeruzalen
description:
Nice hotel, straight beside the bank. (A bit hard to recognize as hotel) 

Friendly owners. Our bicycles could be parked in the patio. 

600 Cor for a room with fan, tv and private badroom.

name: La Vista Restaurant
description: We drove by as many places at the seemed to be closed due to the low number of tourists this year. We asked the security guy of the restaurant and he said it's ok to stay next to the restaurant for 10usd. Quit price but clean toilets and outside shower + strong WiFi. We also could use the beach access the next day.

name: Rual‘s Hotel
description: Very nice, clean and comfortable hotel near the border El Espino

name: Carlos mechanic.
description:
Carlos is a great mechanic, honest and helpful person.
He is working by himself but sharing the warehouse, ask for Carlos if you arrive and see a diferents mechanics.
Say you are friends of Luis from Spain, that's me, I told about ioverlander. 
Good luck and safe travels brother's and sister's!

name: Eco Lodge y Restaurante Blue Morpho
description:
Very nice Hotel and Restaurant, run and owned by Nicaraguan-German couple, Ivánia and Michael. They will allow RVs (max height 3.3m) and tent camping on site, but we didn't ask their rates. We chose to stay in one of their beautiful clean hotel rooms for 36$US including two breakfasts. Not exactly cheap, but with warm water and upscale linens and towels, well worth the price. Good food at reasonable prices in the restaurant (crisp and yummy veggies here!).
Both hosts are very knowledgeable about Nica and Costa Rica, and the place is a good spot to see wildlife, which they will help to spot as well. Wonderful place to stargaze, very little light pollution!
No on-site beach access, but the beach is close by. 
Very good place to be early at the border crossing into Costa Rica from Nicaragua. 
WiFi in the Restaurant area only.

name: Cockteleria Los Laurelitos
description:
Incredible, HUGE bowl of ceviche for 110 cordobas. Maybe the best fish ceviche I’ve ever had. I could only eat half of it and I was full. 20 for a coke. Walking distance from the aduana. Big open air space. Toñas a dollar. So 
good

name: Veterinarian and Purina Pro Plan
description: Wonderful caring knowledgeable vet. Speaks English. Variety of better dog food for sale

name: painting and mechanic
description:
we had our Toyota RV checked and replaced dive pieces from the gear box. very professional people and cheap. the mechanic is called Lolo and works with his sons.

we also painted the whole RV next door with Arsénio, the painter. super nice and professional guy, totally recommended!

name: Centro de Entendimiento con la Naturaleza CEN
description:
This place is just in front of the entrance to trail that goes up to the Macizo. Beautiful and amazing place with good vives. There is a beautiful garden and a place to do yoga near a small river.

They rent rooms and cabañas 200/300 C pp per night. The prices are negotiable. There are shared rooms for rent costing 35 usd per person with breakfast, lunch and dinner. It also includes a path to the rainbow waterfall with a guide. Bathroom included, cold shower.

Saturday and Tuesday there are free capoeira lessons at 4:30 pm

The place is eco-style, everything goes good with nature.

They let us park for free at a place near the property but it really was quite steep. With a couple of stones and a shovel we leveled the camper a bit because the place seemed beautiful.

With the waste from the bathroom they generate gas for the kitchen. They have an orchard with basil, mint, lettuce, squash, custard apple.

They sell the pound of coffee at 100C.

Arturo the manager is the son of Don Chico. For 200 C per person, it guides you to the waterfall and the cloud forest.

From May to February is the rainy season, it is difficult to find a time that does not rain. We were in the best time, we had sunny days and others of rain. Because of this nature is amazing we saw many exotic and beautiful birds. It is part of the Bosawás Biosphere Reserve, the second largest in America after the Amazon.

The truth that the place surprised us, it is worth coming here and stay a couple of days enjoying the energy of this natural paradise.

At the top of the Massif, if you are lucky, you can see the quetzal.

We saw oropendulas!

Do not stop coming to this place if it's just the rainforest, the cloud forest and the contact with nature!

We came to eat in the dining room and to chat with Isaac, the coordinator and guide of the establishment. We do not stay here.

They sell honey.
-----
Nos dejaron estacionar gratis en un lugar cerca de la propiedad pero realmente estaba bastante empinado. Con un par de piedras y con una pala nivelamos un poco el camper porque el lugar nos pareció hermoso.

Con los residuos del baño generan gas para la cocina. Tienen una huerta con albahaca, menta, lechuga, zapallo, anona. 

Venden la libra de cafe a 100C.

Arturo el encargado es el hijo de Don Chico. Por 200 C por persona te hace de guía a la cascada y el bosque nuboso.

Hay cuartos compartidos para rentar cuestan 35 usd por persona con desayuno, almuerzo y cena. Incluye también sendero a la cascada arco iris con guía. Baño incluido, ducha fría.

De mayo a febrero es la temporada de lluvia, es difícil encontrar un momento que no llueva. Nosotros estuvimos en la mejor época, tuvimos días de sol y otros de lluvia. Debido a esto la naturaleza es sorprendente vimos muchos pájaros exóticos y hermosos. Es parte de la Reserva Biosfera Bosawás, la segunda más grande de America después del Amazonas.

La verdad que el lugar nos sorprendió, vale la pena venir aquí y quedarse un par de días disfrutando de la energía de este paraíso natural.

En la cima del Macizo, si se tiene suerte, se puede ver al quetzal. 

Nosotros vimos oropendulas!

No dejen de venir a este lugar si les justa la selva tropical, el bosque nuboso y el contacto con la naturaleza!

Nosotros vinimos a comer al comedor y a charlar con Isaac, el coordinador y guía del establecimiento. No nos hospedamos aquí.

Venden miel de abeja.

name: Walmart
description:
Pretty well stocked Walmart.
Max height for parking is 2,6 mts.
If you’re higher than that let the guard know. They will tell you where to park

name: Museo de la Revolucion
description: Buen sitio para escuchar historias de la Revolución en Nicaragua. Le da un toque perfecto a la visita a León. Great place to hear revolutionary stories in Nicaragua. Give a special flavour to the Leon visit.

name: Supermercado La Unión
description:
No height restriction for vehicles!

Good variety products.

name: Turnoff to road 62 (Escalante)
description:
Note than when coming from Granada, Google Maps may take you through this road on your way to Popoyo. We passed this way and the road is horrendous. No 4x4 needed but high clearance is required.
Better to get to Popoyo from Rivas.

name: Big Surf House
description:
Surf hostel close to Popoyo beach break. Offers dorms and private rooms. It also has a bar and games so you can spend the day between surf sessions.
Mario and Antonio own this place. Overnight parking is not allowed but dorms are 6usd pp. Good vibes.

name: Frenos de Nicaragua
description: Mechanic shop that specialises in repairs of brakes on all types of vehicles: cars, bikes, vans etc. Big garage with cafe inside. friendly, honest, and helpful staff, some speak English which was very helpful. Repaired our brake booster in a day, initially thought it was repaired but after driving a block we could still hear a noise so we returned it and they had another go, second time successful. did not charge for additional manual labor, and even drove us to an errand we needed to run that day whilst they were continuing the repairs.

name: Taller Urroz
description:
Good and honest mechanic, fixed my car's ?direction?. Nobody had the missing parts here, we went to a taller torno to work and fix the existing parts, (cheap).
recommended. Go there in the early morning.

name: Hotel Costa Azul
description: A lovely family owned hotel with the kindest & most accommodating hosts. Fermedat & Martine welcomed us, provided us meals (including fresh caught Mojarro for dinner) for a small charge, and chatted with us. The hotel offers rooms that start at $15 USD, $20 USD with a fan and $30 USD with A/C. As it is on an island, Wifi had sparse connection. Only 5-7 mins on motorcycle to Ojo de Agua and you can walk down the hotels main path to Santo Domingo beach. There's another restaurant next door at Villa Paraiso (but we enjoyed home cooked much more) & a tienda across the street. We parked our motorcycle in front of the hotel and there was a covered section included. Unsure if you could pitch a tent there, worth an ask! All of the surrounding businesses are owned by their own family members so it is a very safe area. They would love to host you!

name: parking lot next to maxipali
description: it's a place of parking for trucks and buses for the night we ask for staying the night and pay 70 cordobas per night it was very safe and quiet.

name: Hotel Magic Night
description: fairly new hotel, AC/Fan, TV, secure parking, breakfast included, water cold, comfy beds.

name: Parque aquatico telica
description: A very nice aquapark, where you can park in the big, closed parking area. We didn't pay any extra for the parking just the entrance fee for the aqua-park, which is 100pp for adults and 70pp for kids, so also affordable if you just come in for a short swim after/before going to the city of Leon, where you can get with a bus easily from here (and also by taxi for ca 150colon). You can have water in the parking and shower, toilets in the aqua-park, if needed.

name: El Peligrino
description: We found this place by chance and really loved it. There’s a big place to park and a big space to hang out in and cook. There’s also a second floor of the building which has a beautiful view of the volcano. Finally there’s a nice breeze and only a few sand flies. The owner Jose is super friendly.  He speaks French and Spanish but not English. There’s also a really good hostel (the Good Life) right on the road in front of El Pelegrino where you can go for amazing meals and to use their Internet. They can arrange tours of the volcanoes and other stuff on the island. They can also wash laundry.  Overall, staying at El Pelegrino and eating some meals at the Good Life  was a perfect combo.  Unfortunately, big rigs can’t fit through the gate by our truck camper was fine (the width is this issue not the height).  I’m not sure I would really call this an established campground but it has many of the things an established campground would have so that’s how I classified it.

name: Comedor La Nanda - must
description: Super local comedor, near pantheon, it’s perfect for lunch not for evening (not very central). Best sopa de mariscos of Leon, it’s a giant bowl for 170cordobas.

name: Lavamatic Express
description: Now in 2022 its 120cordobas for small/medium machine. Dry service not expensive but not really needed with this hot weather

name: Toncontin Airport Long Term Parking
description:
Secure long term parking at the airport where you can leave your car if flying out from Tegucigalpa (we stored our car there whilst visiting the bay islands).

When entering the airport from the main road, there will be a boom gate and parking area to the left, which is the short term parking area and not what you want. For long term, turn right and go through the gate, there should be security there. We payed 12USD or 300L per 24 hour period. 

As a side note, we arrived the night before our flight and the security guard let us park for free just outside the gate to the parking lot, and then let us in the next morning.

name: little hospedaje/auto hotel
description:
nothing fancy, but simple and clean rooms with bathroom. 300C a night condoms and lubricant including..;)
but safe parking with locked gate at night.

name: Petroglyphs
description: Different houses with a sign outside in this area offering a visit to petroglyphs for 1-2$.

name: El Paraiso-Auto Hotel
description:
Couldn’t find anything in town with parking that could fit our van, so headed out on the main road.  Found this place for $20US for the night for 2.  A/C, clean shower, towels, soap...and condom...included! 😛

About 3.5m height restriction on entrance, but there is a 3m limit due to a tree. Park right in front of office that is manned all night.

name: Casa de los Berioss
description: Family run small hotel in wonderful Colonial building. Rooms are simple but have all you want including en suite (and AC for a couple of dollars extra). I paid $14 for single occupancy. Location is perfect only a couple of blocks from Leon cathedral and museum. Hotel also had its own parking inside building for motorcycles through to small campers (height limit about 2.5 metres)

name: Los Cocos Comedor, Free overnight if consum.
description:
Marlon is the owner and is super friendly, it's possible stay free and use the bathroom and shower for free. Nice and good quality on menu with local foods.
The parking it's literally on the beach and it's normally windy which is nice for sleep at night. Safety and quiet place but weekends the locals come to enjoy in this beach but everyone friendly.
They have private rooms and a six bed's dorm and if you want a good price go for talk with them.

name: Hostel Miraflores
description:
We arrived already at night and it was a shot.
But the guy Eder that was at the Hostel was very kind and let us park and open our rooftent at the litlle parking lot to spend the night.
We paid him U$ 10,00 and could use bathroom and shower.

name: Truck Parking Lot Beside Gas Station Petronic
description:
We talked to Alonzo the owner and he let us park our SUV with rooftent between the trucks. 
He is a nice guy and ofered a very simple can bath an bathroom.
