Zopilote is a great place to visit! Great vibe, smoothies, juices, (vegan) food all coming from their own (permaculture) grounds. They offer free yoga, communal dinners and many other workshops. 

Price of the dorm 7 or 8 dollars.

name: Paved brick road (first half) to Cerro Negro
description: This road is brick layed for the first part on the way to Cerro Negro. If you follow this, you will get signs pointing to Cerro Negro all the way. There are a few options to switch between dirt tracks later on, but there are signs on each junction.

name: Cerro Negro Lava Field
description:
Awesome spot to camp (need to pay entrance once, $5pp and then $5pp per night camping). You are in the middle of the lava field at the end of the volcano boarding track. 4x4 not necessary to get here, but clearance and driving skills. Our friends in a lifted 2WD VW Kombi did it, just some sharp rocks on the way in. The sand is solid up to this point. If you want to go further and drive through the valleys, you need 4x4.

You can use the showers and toilets at the visitor center, but it's a kilometer walk.

LTE 4G, 3 bars.

Big rigs can fit (if they make it through the trees on the way up), but you need clearance. Wouldn't do it with a standard clearance sprinter, especially not a long one.

name: Nimbu Beach Hose
description:
Beautiful hostel run by an Austrian woman. Dorm room beds with breakfast included are $20 and they have a restaurant.

We asked about camping in our van as well, but they would only do it for $20 per person (with breakfast and dinner included) and their parking lot is quite small.

Should be good for working (fast wifi) and has direct beach access for surfing.

I think it's a good option if you are backpacking, a bit too much for overlanders, unless you are out of food anyway (the included dinner sounded nice). We had the fridge full and didn't want to spoil it so moved on.

name: Restaurant Barco de Oro
description: Nice restaurant and Hostal at the ocean side, clean and good food. Sandrine, the french owner welcomed us to stay with our Unimog in the parking and to use the facilities. We paid 5 $ for the night and had a meal in the restaurant.

name: Bomberos Granada
description: Due to covid crisis, we parked our rig in the fire station for 18 months.  Good place and secure to let your rig for long-term parking.  We paid around 20 USD/month.

name: La Gran Sultana (moto friendly)
description: Probably one of the better deals. Walking distance from everything, motos can go inside their large lobby, pool, rooftop terrace, A/C… rooms are small but ok for short term. We paid $25 for a matrimonial. Friendly staff… comes with a basic breakfast.

name: Ojo de Agua
description:
Great place to relax in the shade of the old growth trees, swim in the crystalline waters of the springs, enjoy a rum coconut, some food… refreshing and relaxing
At time of writing it was $5 per person to get in.

name: Banpro ATM
description: ATM open late (maybe 24 hours). Door to the ATM is on the corner furthest away from the church

name: Aguasana
description:
Shop with garrafons, $70 per garaffon. 

Next to La Colonia. convenient, with big parking lot.
 
They were able to refill our own garrafons. Hector, the owner who is from New York was very friendly and gave us many tips in and around Granada.

name: Banco LAFISA
description: This is the bank where you need to pay for IPSA and CETREX for your pet paperwork. Long lines as always. ATMs here as well.

name: Traffic Police Stop (Bribery Attempt)
description:
Not sure if these are the exact correct coordinates, maybe +/- a few KM in either direction, but there was a police checkpoint and we got pulled over. Told we had “illegally crossed the middle yellow line” and had to pay a fine. Then they said $50 and we could go. Then went down to 700C. They threatened to keep our (old) license until we paid at the bank and said we couldn’t get our license back until the next day (eventually said we’d have to wait 15 days, lol).

We never paid, just kept wasting their time. Took us 30 minutes. Said we’d rather pay at the bank than give them a ‘multa’. Eventually, they let us off and even gave us back our license.

Maybe 8-10km after (correction going to Costa Rica) there was another police check point. 

Advice: in this area, don’t speed and don’t cross any solid yellow lines, even if all the locals do it.

name: Lavamatic Express
description: You can do your own laundry or have them do it. It takes 2-2.5 hours and they notify you via WhatsApp. The owner speaks perfect English, and was very helpful. He said he has the only laundromat in all of town. A bit pricy, 350C for 8-10ish lbs but everything came back clean and folded.

name: Brisas Del Lago
description:
Pretty and relatively quiet and cool spot to park or put up your tent for the night next to an unused lakeside restaurant.

The property is owned by Juan and his family who are living on the same lot but closer to the road. The restaurant itself is not open at the moment although Juan is planning to fix it up again and open it back up.

For now there are no facilities but a beautiful view over the lake, trees for shade, a roof to hide from the rain and a slight to strong breeze from the lake for a cool night.

Close to but not visible from the road, some traffic noise but not too bad. 
Convenient place to take a break from driving and enjoy the view and the breeze.

Juan did not charge us but asked for a voluntary donation so we gave him 100 cordoba.

name: Hotel Southern Nights
description:
The hotel is run by a very friendly US man, Robbie. At the back entrance is a nice grassy field with trees and a gate that's locked at night. 5 camper places fully hooked up. Nice for tents as well.
We recommend this place.
 $15 p night. safe and quiet. Walking distance to the harbour where you can take the boat to Ometepe (wonderful).

name: Palapa Camp
description:
Large property with ocean view. 350 meters from the beach.
Restaurants/bars, grocery, stadium by walking distance 50-250 meters...
You would be on your own as the eco-building project didn't start yet.
We might need use some Palma leave to make a dry toilet place :)

No drinkable water (it's the water provided by the city), we have a "pila" as a water retention to water the plants, it's like a mini swimming pool of 3m x 2m x 1m high.

You can put up your tent or park a camping car.
No electricity => might be able to get electricity from neighbors for some $$
No dumping station

Owners: We are renting a house down the hill about 200 meters from the land. We have couple of surfboards we can rent out.

name: La Engorda
description: Good place to stay a night. Restaurant with large parking lot for trucks. 50C for the night with toilet and shower. Safe an quiet at night.

name: Granada RV Park and Camping
description:
Safe Clean Camping/Parking for all vehicles or Campers. Internet is good.
$17/couple. $12/solo
No Electricity for Vehicles. Only for cellphones and computers.
10 minute walk from Central Park.
3 minute walk to Market.
+505 88422587

name: Refugio de Vida Silvestre Chacocente (Turtle Nesting Reserve)
description: Rustic camping with a few shaded areas. 200m walk to beach on a good path. clean untouched long beach with no people and lots of wildlife. between August to Jan is turtle season - you can follow the park rangers around on the night shifts to see turtles laying eggs, or eggs hatching. There is also military here and they follow the Rangers at night (and guard the camp) so it's pretty safe. They are mainly here to guard the sea border but they also keep an eye on the turtle operation (government-run). Park entry is 100C per person per day. we had our own toilet and shower so we didn't have to pay for camping. from Santa Teresa to the turn-off is 20km of dirt road good quality but many shallow hard packed creek crossings fine for 2wd in dry weather. once you turn off the road (which goes from Santa Teresa to Astillero), it gets really rough. there is a river crossing which was nearly knee deep, you need to walk it and drive over the Rocky parts, the exit was quite steep you need to search for it before you cross the river. from here the road is rough and some clearance is required. I made it in a ford E150. a tall van could be an issue as some parts of the track are not level and your vehicle will be tilted. Also very steep and not good during wet weather. from Santa Teresa there are many signs along the way. It's worth the drive as it's quiet, safe and you can see the turtles.

name: Corrupt police at check point
description: Approx location on this road. I provided good licence, registration, insurance and temp import permit and the officer then proceeded to say we weren't wearing seat belts. watch out for these corrupt police. Don't give in to their lies they just want money. if you have a passenger that speaks good spanish get them to defend you otherwise don't get involved just play dumb. only hand over copies of everything.

name: Hush
description: The best views of sunsets in Nicaragua, good value for what you get. They have an infinity pool, good restaurant, friendly staff, cute puppies, the dorm is 22$ but worth it. Would definitely recommend to come and see the sunsets here

name: convenience store with shady tables
description: if your lucky parking out the front. cheap drinks. fried chicken and chips. basic groceries. 1/2 beach view from shady tables. cheapest beer in San Juan del sur

name: Manuel's / Bary's
description: Manuel's restaurant - the sign out front says Bary's. Meals range between $4 - $8 USD. Great food (especially the fish), nice bathrooms and shower, and Manuel (the owner) is the nicest person. When we told him we were camping he assured us the area is safe and that he would watch out for our van while we explored Granada during the day. After staying 2 nights we were sad to leave and say goodbye to Manuel!

name: El Cambio Accesorios y Lubricantes
description:
Oil changes only.

Oil and engine filter change $60 USD (includes 6L of 5w20 synthetic and filter). Price is for material and labour is free.

Hours: Monday - Saturday 7:40 - 16:45.

Small space would not recommend for RVs.
Recommended by Freddy & Freddy Jr. from the other iOverlander mechanic spot "Freddy Salgado".

name: Taller Soluciones Franklin - Chequeo Gratis
description:
Free brakes inspection.

They can repair on site good prices.

name: ATM Next to Foodmarket
description:
Of the left side of the Supermarket is an ATM
Dollares & Cordobas

name: Laguna to Mirador Hike
description: Nice Hiking trail from the Laguna de Apoyo to the Mirador de Diria. Start here and walk directly beside the shore. Trail is relatively well marked in red color and letters "TSA". The way up to the Mirador starts from a small bay and you can choose between a small road and footpaths. We saw a lot of monkeys in the forest. Roundtrip Duration 3-4 hours. You can park at the iOverlander Spot "Free beach- Lago De Apoyo".

name: Wild camp
description: Wild camp . Only animals and villagers were here . We had amazing view .

name: Field near the lake
description: Very closed to the city, this plane área is so quite. Lake view, not too much cars on the road. Only horses and cows will come to meet you !!

name: Rancho Gracias a Dios
description:
Very nice place and super friendly people, they are planning to build a campsite in the future but for now they are happy to let you pitch your tent overnight and you can order your dinner here for cheap, this a restaurant actually

Totally recommended

name: Casa Lula Hostel
description:
Very comfortable and quiet hostel with private rooms (w/bathroom) for 35US$ pp (cash) with fan, 45US$ with AC (from 8pm to 8am). Accepts cards too, + 15% IVA tax. Also dorms with shared bathrooms. Full kitchen, washing machine (extra) and small secure parking for motorcycles or 1 car. Water and beer available to purchase, but markets nearby. Close to everything. No hot water, but it's not needed in León! Owners Roger and Selena very friendly. 2 dogs and 2 cats. Pet friendly, but your pets must behave.
+505 2311 1076/ +505 7660 7357

name: Charco Verde
description: We stayed in the parking across from the building to Charco Verde reserve for free. We left the reserve after the building closed, slept peacefully all night and nobody said anything the next morning when we left around 10.

name: La Birria
description:
Very tasty beef burritos (can also ask for chicken instead) for 160C. Theyre standard size, so I recommend getting 2. Options for dine-in, take-away (add 12C for packaging) or delivery (add 30C). 

They also have pulled pork, tacos, Ramen, and a couple other items, though I did not try them

name: Armed Robbery
description:
German traveller staying at my hostel was robbed by 3 locals, 1 with a knife, while he was walking on the trails back to Matagalpa from Selva Negra.

They only took his phone even though he was wearing a backpack with his wallet and other items

name: Comedor Los Cocos
description:
Nice little breakfast place (filled with locals, so you know it's good) 

Great pancakes for 50C
Tipico breakfast with coffee 80C
Other options available

name: Road Does Not Exist!
description:
The road from here to Bluefields DOES NOT EXIST! Look on Google Maps satellite view (or see pics)- where it says the road is, is clearly forest and a river with no bridge or ferry.

It is instead possible to take a boat from here up the river to Bluefields, but I did not ask for details. I'm guessing the actual road to Bluefields is from Nueva Guinea, but that needs verification. There's no road from there on Google Maps, but there is on Maps.me

name: IPSA Pet Export Office
description:
This “ventanilla” window for IPSA is the one you need to get your pet export certificate for Costa Rica. If you don’t have this certificate, they will not give you a permit for your pet in Costa Rica. You can take a chance without it but if the Costa Rican police stops you and you haven’t correctly imported your pet to Cost Rica, they can take your pet away from you. This IPSA window is hard to find, that’s why I am posting the GPS coordinates. It is right across from the Pasajero Terminal right when you pass the first pre-check where they give you your aduana form for the car. Past the two huge air conditioning units in the left. See the photos. They open at 8:30 am

Please note that prior to this you need to visit the Vet and Cetrex offices in Rivas to get a Pet Health Certificate and a form from Cetrex. Both are on IOverlander under pet services.

name: Iniser
description: In case you forgot to buy insurance at the border, you can buy it at any iniser in the big cities

name: Vulcanizadora Chanel - Tyre repair
description: In the back streets they work on the street. 180 for a large patch on inside of tubeless car tyre whatsapp +506 83880991 Manuel

name: Centro cultural next to Hotel sueño de la campaña
description:
After having some trouble to go to finca esperanza verde, we ask the police that lead us to this place. 
We met Harris, an incredible español guy who run the centro cultural and he let us stay here, use the bathroom and toilets. 
It just a parking lot but if you meet with Harris, it will make your day!
Good for one night, restaurant on site

name: Matagalpa Parking secure
description:
A large parking place in the middle of town. No restrictions. Much better than that at the restaurant or bomberos. 
100 cord. Night

name: Reserva Kilimanjaro
description:
Because Reserva Jaguar was closed we decided to go here. André (the owner) was really friendly even though he never received overlanders before, and likes you all to visit as well.

The road to get here is bumpy but during dry season no 4x4 was needed. Not sure about rain season, but probably still doable without 4x4.

A beautiful farm with cabanas and campspots. They grow coffee and fruits, and own a lot of horses, cows and pigs. They are self sustainable and have their own hydroelectric power. If you have 4x4 you can camp on top of the hill of their land and have a great view and a lot of privacy. 

There are different paid activities they offer like milking the cows, ride horses and do tours in the mountains. It is a cloud forest area and there are tons of birds. They asked for 15$ for two persons and 5$ extra for breakfast/lunch/dinner.

name: Camping à la pointe
description:
Translation:Wild camping in a tent on the beach, quiet place, magnificent sunset!
Small cabin, tables and restaurants.
In the evening after sunset there is no one, it is very quiet.
Possibility to stay in the parking lot with a Van or a 4x4.

Camping sauvage en toile de tente sur la plage, lieu tranquille, magnifique couché de soleil!
Petite cabane, tables et restaurants.
Le soir après le couché de soleil il n'y a plus personne, c'est très calme.
Possibilité de rester sur le parking avec un Van ou un 4x4.

name: French Bakery
description: Real French Bakery managed by a Nicaragua & French couple. We loved the break, real French bread and viennoiserie. Open from 8 to 4pm every day.

name: pita pita
description: upscale Mediterranean restaurant specializing in middle eastern dishes and pizza. apps from 5 to 8 bucks. entres from 8 to 12. BOGO cocktails from 4 to 6

name: Veterinaria Fletes Aguilar
description: Kevin at Grenada RV park found this guy for us that only charged 400C each for our health certificates for our dogs. Kevin's vet wanted 50 bucks for the same thing and others wanted 70 in town! quick and easy. had the account numbers ready you will need to go to the bank to make deposits. one was 150c and the other was 13$.

name: Playa Amarillo
description: Free place to sleep facing the sea. Quiet and safe with some shade.  I recommend

name: Tapas and surf
description: Private cabana with shower and bathroom with 2 beds for 50us. Free breakfast. Secure area. Middle of a wide surf. Great surfing area. Local beer 1.5$, corona 4$. Lunch meals are about $10. Need to take 2 kilometre gravel road. Top rated place. Has pool

name: fuente pura (agua)
description: gallons refill at a small water provide. the also sell smaller size. 87 cordobas for 5 gallons.

name: Casa Benjamin Linder Hotel
description: 2 bed clean room with good washroom and shower attached. Paid 20us dollars and parked 2 motorcycles. Ac is extra $13us. Has room for camper but don’t know if they allow. Has tent place but also don’t know if they allow. Free breakfast. Very secure. Large grocery store is 2 blocks away

name: Nuestra Casa B&b
description: Nice, super clean. Large double bedroom. AC is cold. Secure motorcycle parking or one car. Paid $60us in high season, national holiday. Free filtered water and breakfast. Fast internet. It has a small sign and easy to miss. They have a sister hostel down the street. If no-one here go to hostel to get staff. 1.5 block from beach. A lot of activities at the beach.

name: Near Tapas and Surf
description:
Super chill and fresh place over night. We just parked near the way in front of the wave. 
If you consume in Tapas and Surf you can use toilet, the shower and wifi. Felt very safe

name: potable city water filling station
description: they have a tap inside the gate but  near the street that someone will access for you. its potable and i filled my 20pL tank for free.

name: lavenderia grand plus
description: hard to find a lavenderia in Rivas on google. as Abys lavenderia is closed

name: Comedor
description: We had dinner and slept in front of the little restaurant of this tiny pueblo and could even fill up our tank with water (water from the school). For 4 cenas and drinks and some homemade cookies 510C. People were very nice and the night was very very quiet. They said we can give something for the night, we did give 150C and we bought cheese, coffee and jams from the tiendq. All are delicious. We really liked this little detour in this community.

name: Las Palmas
description:
Hotel / House with an interior courtyard.
 John the owner is American, super nice and accepts that we stay in his courtyard for a few nights (not a month for example) and that we use the toilets at his house, the outdoor shower and the communal kitchen.  The real plus is the calm and cleanliness.  His Watsapp: +1 (303) 525 3122. Call him before coming.  We paid US$10 per night for 2 people and the Van.  Accessible for all sizes of truck but the terrain can only contain 2 or 3 maximum.

name: Park - Malpaisillo
description: We arrived in this village by chance.  We parked around the park in the health center parking lot.  The locals told us it was calm, safe and quiet.  Indeed very quiet during the night.  Everyone was very nice to us.  We ate around the park.  There is water in the park

name: Oldest church of Nicaragua
description: In a little town, ciudad Antigua, there is the oldest church of Nicaragua. White in front but when you made the turn you can see that the church is old. Nice town and really really calm

name: Water Spigot at a gas station
description: Have been looking for a place to fill up on water for a while. This gas station has a spigot with good pressure and the attendants were okay to let me fill up our tank...

name: Worldwash laundry
description: Laundry between Managua and Masaya. Convenient because right on the road. 1$ per kilo for washing and drying. Not cheap but good service. 1h30 for 18kg of clothes.

name: Uno - LSD
description:
NPTICE: Only Low Sulfur Diesel (500ppm). There is no ULSD in Nicaragua.

// Uno with ultra low sulphur diesel "Uno diesel con dynamax" available //

name: Mister car Autocentro - Peak lubricantes
description:
The place doesn’t look like a propane filling place, but it is. Actually we were able to fill our tank even though it isn’t Tropigas.
We left our 10 pounds gas tank in the morning here, and it was filled up after lunch. It cost 182 córdobas. 

——————————————————-

Aquí llenamos nuestro tanque costarricense de gas de 10L por 182 córdobas. Lo dejamos en la mañana y después de almuerzo ya estaba listo. Es una venta de cosas para autos, pero también llenan tanques de gas aunque no sean marca Tropigas.

name: Ceramicas Miguel Angel
description: We loved this little place with tons of ceramics. Miguel’s shop and taller is 100% artisanal. He learned his job with his grandfather and parents. We went there to buy a few ceramics objects (vase, plate…) and we had the chance Miguel told us about the art of ceramics, and we all (5 of us) did try to do a piece. So it was basically a ceramics lesson. We paid for the objects, that’s all. Not for the lesson that lasted almost 2 hours. The kids and the adults loved it ! Miguel was very patient and very nice. Here is his whatsapp if you want to check if he is available before going: +505 8164 0611

name: Natural Pool
description:
Recommended to us by locals. Unfortunately the pool was drained when we got there for maintenance but looks like a cool place and water comes from a natural spring that feels really fresh. Petroglyph on site as well and just a short walk to Finca Magdalena...

27/11 it's open, 40 Cordoba entrance

name: Puerto San Jorge
description: Spent the night here to get the ferry to San Jose at 9:30am the next day. 100C for RV and family of 5. Gated, security, quiet, very safe. We arrived around 6pm and the nice guard explained we could stay here. Very convenient. A few palapas to sit down. Kids playground too. Nice parking option. FREE WIFI. Basuras everywhere. Possible to fill up water tank without problem.

name: Only ATM outside of Moyogalpa
description: ATM inside the gas station. Was told by locals this is the only ATM outside of Mayagalpa. Plays music, dispenses cash... pretty cool! 😀

name: Playas Mango
description: Nice little beach with restaurant, kayak rental, swings, super friendly staff, bon fires and the most amazing view of Volcano Concepcion. The sunsets here are amazing. Place charges a daily cover of 40cordoba per person.

name: Across the road from the Sendoro to Concepcion volcano
description: We were meeting our guide for hiking the Concepcion volcano the next day early so we slept directly across the sendero where the hike starts. This is next to the road so of course a little noise but there are so little traffic on the island these days, we heard like 5 cars and 10 bikes so perfectly ok. FREE spot where we left our RV for the day during the hike. Space for like 2 to 3 vehicles not more and ok for 1 night before hiking.

name: Road to Telica Volcano
description:
This is the correct start of the road to Telica volcano. Depending on where you're starting from, Google Maps and Maps.Me will lead you to a road starting from NN252 instead. That will not work out though if you want to reach the other spots where you can camp or park for an easy hike to the crater! Locals told us this is the only way. 
High clearance needed, without 4x4 you might not make it until the very end. If your rig is >3m in height and >2.2m in width you might not make it either due to overgrown tracks.

name: Playa Hermosa
description:
Nice beach, the entrance is $3 per person but they do not allow the entry of food or drinks, for which they force you to consume in the hotel bar. Prices above average. There is cell phone signal.

Linda playa, la entrada sale $3 por persona pero no permiten el ingreso de comidas ni bebidas por lo cuál te obligan a consumir en el bar del hotel. Precios por encima de la media. Hay señal de celular.

name: Zapatertours
description:
Boat Tours Isletas and Zapatera Islands.
Bilingual certified captain.
21 foot searay.
230 horsepower.

name: Apartments to rent for night
description: This is a family house that rents rooms for the night and cheap price. We are a couple that rent a private room with private bathroom for 10 usd (it isn't 5 usd per person...just the room for 10 usd). Just a bed and a fan. Every hostel was between 9 or 10 usd per person (with breakfast). We made this choice where you also can use the kitchen. We parked the car in the street and everything was good. The phone number is +505 89567950 (is on the door)

name: Puerto San Carlos
description: This is where you can take a boat to El Castillo. You can buy tickets at the office 150C pp (kids under 6 gratis) and there is a secure parqueo directly at the port, price is 60C/day.

name: Mr. Seafood
description: Great big area to park, guards at night. Of course we ate here, i dont think they would have let us stay here otherwise. People were very friendly.

name: Carwash
description: Perfect stop for a carwash with really nice guys! Fast, clean and fair price. Looks like you can sleep there too, - they have a big green garden with shade, but we didn't ask.

name: “Huellas”
description: Amazing place to stay in Balgüe, just 200 m down the main road, but it feels like in the middle of the jungle. Big beautiful property, the owner Phoenix is a very good person and lovely guy, he is always happy for volunteers- his Whatsapp contact: +50578771280. Overlanders are very welcome, you can park your car in the green parking lot. There is an outdoor shower, bathroom, communal kitchen and a big garden to chill out, looking at the volcano or the monkeys in the trees. They have rooms too and a dorm for volunteers. We slept a week in our van, helped a little bit around the house and could sleep there for free, using all the facilities. (And refill our water tank.) They have also a very sweet dog “Bella”, she will protect you day and night. We love this place and really can recommend it!

name: Universal Guesthouse
description:
Wooden house with a view on the river. It has two nice and comfortable terraces to enjoy the Rio San Juan.
It's also close to where the panga arrives. It has rooms with private bathroom (10$pp) or shared bathroom (500 cordobas).

name: Estancia Victoriana
description: Big grassy areas for rigs, bathrooms, clean pool, restaurant, huge overlook overlooking the volcano and lava fields. They also have cabanas, $45 USD a night for a room with patio. Not sure about price for camping. Allowed our dog.

name: Clínica Médica Dr Ayax Pérez
description: Medical Clínic, General Medicine.  This is a small Medical clinic which opens in the morning every day. It is attended by a medical doctor who is bilingual.

name: San Ramon river crossing
description: Just off the Panamericana and down to the river. It's a gravel track. Locals cross the river here, do laundry, or just hang around close to the water. Friendly people. Not so clean: the usual trash can be found. Safe place. Reasonably quiet, in the evening there's the church, in the early morning traffic (crossing the river) starts. Mobile internet available, both Claro and Tigo.

name: Lakeside
description: Reachable by a road that is a riverbed but it is also drivable in the rainy season because of the concrete tracks. Friendly locals, beautiful view. Some shade if you want it. Cools down nicely in the evening. Spent 3 nights here. Some night fishing, but very quiet . Good cell phone reception (Claro and Tigo) . Nice beach. Very little trash. You can see both volcanoes from here.  There is a small river leading to the lake. You can camp at the river or drive through it and camp directly at the beach. Not sure if the road is suitable for a big rig but there is enough room at the lake.

name: Pena Rota
description: Spend 3 nights here. Beachcamping between the trees. Very reasonable off-road track, probably also drivable with 2 wheel drive. A few locals. Safe and quiet. A little bit of cellphone reception with Tigo, almost nothing with Claro,. There are two sheds which are comidas but both were closed in the weekend and on monday, maybe permanently closed. A little bit of trash lying around. But: MOSQUITOES!!!

name: Casa de los rios
description:
Good place for camping with a view of the sea. Toilet and outside shower. 50m to beach. $5pp.
.....
Bel endroit pour camper avec vue mer. Toilettes et une diuche externe. Plage a 50 m. Famille tres sympa. Cout 5 dollars pp.

name: Fishing Car Park
description:
Grass car park in the closed land of the fishermen. Accept motorhomes for a cost of 200 córdoba per night. No basic showers and toilets but shade and direct access to the beach. Friendly welcome.
--------
Parqueo de Campo de pescado

Parking en herbe dans terrein ferme des pecheurs. Acceptent les camping car pour un cout de 200 córdoba la nuit. Pas de douches et toilettes de base mais ombrage et acces direct a la plage. Accueil sympathique.

name: kioskito el palo
description:
Friendly Small kiosk selling snacks, bread and  drinks.
I mainly stopped there to get some shadow and fresh drink. good spot for a break while biking on that long sunny road.
Also a small mechanic taller next to it.

name: Lessons Popoyo Surf
description: Great view of the beach from your parking spot, best we could find on this side of the river! It’s kind of just an undeveloped beachfront property with just a little metal palapa, a few trees to park under. Pit toilet and an outdoor crazy 360 degree shower contraption. Sink and hose for washing up. Bricks near the palapa if you need to level. Watch for ants. $5/pp

name: Ana Umaña’s
description:
Amazing view right beside the ocean, very basic amenities. Pit toilet, sink with fresh water for washing up, a structure to hang your hammock, limited 3G signal, grassy. 
We asked about security, they said basically don’t leave anything outside when you’re on the beach/surfing/overnight. We did just that, stayed 2 nights with no issues. $10/night for 2 people with some bartering and agreeing to stay 2 nights. 

People reference this place in the wild camping down the road, but I thought I’d add it as an actual campground on iOverlander. There are reports of thefts in the other post. Don’t leave your stuff outside when you’re gone/at night. Even flip flops.

name: Au bord du lac
description:
Location by the lake a little high without amenities Space for 2 vans with a passable dimension by a 2x2 van.  Beautiful lake view and perfect little beach.  No bar or restaurant nearby.  Very quiet Free
----
Emplacement au bord du lac un peu en hauteur sans commoditées   Place pour 2 van avec une cote praticable par un fourgon 2x2. Belle vue sur le lac et petite plage parfaite. Pas de bar ni restaurant a cote. Tres tranquille   Free

name: Juntos - Gringo food!
description: Nice small beachfront restaurant with a great gringo menu. The avocado wrap and salads are awesome. Falafels, burgers, wings, fancy salads, poutine. Everything is 200-300c. Pool table.

name: Car Wash El Macho
description: Big car wash that can fit big rigs. They have ramps, so you can have the undercarriage washed also. 150c for outside of our truck camper, 250c for outside and chassis.

name: El Ceibo Museum
description: This museum down a dirt road is a very worthy stop.  One man has collected over 2,000 pieces of pre-Colombian artifacts from his property and the neighboring area.  The collection is displayed according to the time period it was made as well as grouped by subject matter.  An English-speaking guide walked me through the whole collection and shared fascinating history, local lore and facts.  The cost per person at $8 is a great deal for what you get.  A fascinating stop.

name: Military Nicaragua
description:
we were stopped by the Nicaraguan military for a passport control and vehicle papers (tip).  remember to present the entry ticket to Nicaragua with the stamp.

Copies of all were enough.

name: Hotel Santa Pozo
description: Wide street to park in front, under a bright light, lady said there are cameras. Probably a good place to wild camp too. Rooms are overlooking the road, so you can keep and eye on your rig. Nice rooms, modern washrooms, screens on windows, AC (remote is in the drawer), hot showers. She said $30/night, we offered $25 and she said sure. Perfect location.

name: Bad road
description: The road down to the Secret Cove is undrivable even with 4x4. Dirt bikes might make it.

name: Lake and Volcano viewpoint
description:
Nice pull-off and viewpoint of Lake Xolotan.
Possible wild camping spot.  $0.10 Banos down the hill on the right side.  No litter strewn about!

name: Ruiz cafe
description: Little hotel, cheap with indoor motorcycle parking. single room with private bathroom for 14$.

name: Bridazul coffee
description:
We dry coffee during the harvest season (Nov-May) and there is limited space for cars, vans or campers but there is more space outside of the harvest period. Must like dogs and preferably coffee!

*Contact via website for availability.

name: BAC Credomatic
description: The only atm inside a bank with security guard (this is a safe town, but for people looking for extra security this place is guarded). Accepts foreign cards.

name: La Llamarada del Bosque
description: Best place for buffet style breakfast or lunch, every day freshly prepared with fresh ingredients.

name: Puma Gasolinera
description: ATM inside the gas station, best to use BAC atm for foreign cards.

name: Pali supermarket
description: Cheapest supermarket in town. Groceries available.

name: San Judas supermarket
description: Supermarket with biggest variety in town, also some no-sugar and no-dairy alternatives, bit on the expensive side.

name: El Mercadito de Nancy
description:
Excellent little Comedor, very friendly welcome and excellent chicken tacos for 50cordobas
---
Excellent petit Comedor, accueil très sympa et tacos au poulet excellent pour 50cordobas

name: Nahua Lodge
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner. 

We live on a permaculture farm near the Pan-American Highway. We offer places for all types of vehicles or the possibility to stay in a tent with us.
You can enjoy the view on Ometepe, the beautiful Island in the Lake Nicaragua.
Please contact us before you will visit us, so we can help with directions and to ensure we are around and have space available, via Instagram or WhatsApp +505 7877 1464. It can be tricky to find the entrance to our farm.
We live very simple in an old American Schoolbus.
Pricing 7 - 15$ per night.

name: David's Place
description:
Perfect place in the garden, secured. Owner speaks Spanish, Russian*, Dutch and a little English. Wifi, shower, toilet. He can give info about the environment, the Masaya. You can use the kitchen, electricity and the washing machine. 
He also has 3 rooms. 
Prices vary.  If you want the room, it is 12 dollars. With 8 dollars.
If you want, he can make breakfast and bring you to the vulcan mayasa.
+505 8962 9626

name: Hotel Cana Brava
description: Clean, quiet - auto-hotel. Secure parking. Perfect for bikes or SUV small trucks. Fan no AC. $10. Does the trick.

name: Touricentro Parking Lot
description: Right at the lake, regular parking lot, clean, safe. A restaurant nearby with toilets 10 C, several vendors with music till around 10 pm. Direct access to the lake. Fast free WiFi. Quiet at night, at least during the week, might be busy at weekends.

name: Tostometro!
description:
You need to try this! Burgers made of plantains with so many delicious flavors. You can have a veggie/vegan one or with meat (chicken, pork or beef). The salsas are exceptional, the pumpkin salsa is a family recipe. 

170 cordoba for any burger

For the fans: Ewan McGregor ate here too!

name: bridazul
description:
We dry coffee here during the coffee harvest. There's permanently somebody there. We just started working here, so amenities for campers are going to improve.
Always contact owners before arriving please +50558576630

name: Brisas de Isla Ometepe, Nicaragua
description: A homestay with a warm, friendly Nicaraguan family. A private room with a double and a single bed, wifi, washroom and shower, secure parking minutes from the city centre and a 7 minute car ride to the lake. Max and Martha speak some English and have welcomed many tourists to their family. Plus, if you need laundry done they can do it here. $20 USD per night. you can use WhatsApp or email: canolorena08@gmail.com

name: Asados Las Brasas
description: Very tasty asado (grilled meat) for fair prices. Huge portions, friendly and attentive staff.

name: Bad road to Cerro Negro
description:
Wondering about the mixed reports of good/bad road conditions to the camp spots at Cerro Negro - we probably found the explanation!

There are 2 „main“ tracks leading up to Cerro Negro visitor center: the one from Léon which is in a very good condition (we took it on the way down) and the one coming from north passing through Malpaisillo (we took this on the way up). 

The Malpaisillo track is in very bad shape, many rocks and big holes in the road, vegetation quite dense. We made it up with our 4x4 Chevy but any rig bigger than us will definitely get severe scratches. 

Also during rainy season, the puddles get knee deep and some places were pretty muddy. 

Google maps navigation is also not correct so we ended up in someone’s private property. They were super nice and helped us to find the right track… just ask around, the locals will guide you the right way.

Down the other path to Leon was smooth, sandy track without any major potholes and vegetation not that dense, any van 2wd should be able to make it up!

We met two travelers making it up with 2wd the same road as us, probs to them, they must have had some serious driving skills. But they ended up with a flat tire so if in doubt, better take the Leon route ;)

name: Auto Taller San Juan
description:
Mechanical services and maintenance for cars, trucks and overland vehicles. Eddie and his family run the garage, speaks good English, very helpful and resourceful, reasonable price. Good and honest. We had our Ford F250 Truck Camper serviced here.  Oil and filter changed, check all brakes. Got a bodywork guy to help repair a cracked tie down on the camper.  Even let us use toilet and shower.
Was recommended by another Overlander.

name: Harvest House
description: Nice little hostel within easy walking distance of the town square. There’s a large secure private car park opposite the hostel that has tons of space. No height restrictions. Owners are nice. $15/night for a simple room with shower. 50C/day for the parking, about $1.50. Kitchen in the hostel.

name: Auto Taller San Juan
description:
Mechanical services and maintenance for cars, trucks and overland vehicles. Eddie and his family run the garage, speaks good English, very helpful and resourceful, reasonable price. Good and honest. We had our Ford F250 Truck Camper serviced here. Oil and filter changed, check all brakes. Got a bodywork guy to help repair a cracked tie down on the camper. Even let us use toilet and shower. 
Was recommended by another Overlander. 84662676 whatsapp

name: Police asking for insurance
description: Be sure to have insurance before crossing this checkpoint, they charged us 1500 cordobas for not having it.

name: Hostal Villas Mexico
description: We were having a hard time finding a place to stay near San Juan del Sur, and when we asked at this place they said we could park for USD 10 p.p per night. It's not perfect, bathrooms are not the cleanest, but the wifi is great and we enjoyed the shade. They also have swimming pools you can use and offer eletricity.

name: Jungle Roots Camping and Family Kitchen
description:
Lovely family with a beautiful property to stay on. Valdamir, Faran, and their 3 kids are excited to welcome you. Faran is originally from Nicaragua but worked as a private chef in California for many years so can prepare you an amazing meal or smoothie for a reasonable price. 

Huge level concrete pad for parking and camping any sized rig. So much abundance in the garden. Dog friendly. $5 USD a night for now but they are working on building the property up so the price would increase as they add more services. 

They also have a beautiful guest house you could rent for your stay.  

Reach out to Faran on Whatsapp +505 7811 4963

name: Kayak rental (with or without guide)
description:
gabriel lorio gave me the best price on a kayak rental I have found on the island it can be 6$ for a whole day if you have a group. if you can pay more I would! he can guide you to see caiman and other creatures of the lake and the river. he also does horse tours, and he can rent you a moto or a taxi! really anything you could need.
+50582142971 watsapp him! gabriel lorio

name: Camping Monte los Olivos
description: 10$ per night. Room for private parking! tents or hammock camping. I stayed with Allan for a month while he developed his land to host people! 1$ to camp or park your car shower and bathrooms included. He has an extra scooter at times! another 1$ for a good kitchen! Really amazing local who helped me more than anyone in my travels with my Spanish practice! I think this is his gift really, such gentle help with speaking.

name: Hospedaje Lasser 1
description: Very basic hospedaje in Central Rivas. No parking but we were able to store our bicycles in the back room and seems safe enough. Clean enough for $10, friendly owners. Private room with fan and basic bathroom. Clean bedding.

name: Southern Nights hotel
description: There is a dump!! Nice camping owned by an nice American.

name: Susanne & Julio
description:
Camp at our orchard with tent, car or camper van. Park your vehicle here to go visit El Castillo by boat. Enjoy lush green nature & wildlife. Get to know rural Nicaragua & way of living.

Contact: +505 86767847

5 $ p.P. includes
- shared toilet & shower
- free access to well water
- electricity
- WiFi
- use of property facilities
- fresh fruit & vegetables on our farm (depending season)

If available: Comfortable cabin with private bathroom and beautiful nature view

Things to do here:
- cacao-Tour & Chocolate Making
- visit Nicaraguan run cattle farm
- boat trip, fishing & animal observation
- visit El Castillo & Indio Matz Reserve

name: Sonzapote
description: About here are the stone statues, some of them replicas and others original. To see more of the originals visit the museum in the Convento San Francisco in Granada. To reach this island take a boat tour from Granada.

name: Stone carvings
description: On the highest point of this island is a rock plateau covered with ancient carvings. Some are still well preserved whereas others are fading away. You can visit this island as part of a boat tour from Granada.

name: Free wifi
description: Free, decent speed, Nice old center city

name: Lucy hostel
description:
es un hostal básico y la suena es muy amable, la noche en habitación compartida cuesta 6 USD con desayuno 8 USD, el desayuno es increíble! también hay habitaciones privadas. los baños no son lo mejor.

Is a basic hostal, the owner Is very friendly, the Night are 6 USD and with breakfast 8 USD. the breakfast Is awesome!. the bathroom isn't the best

name: Gabcha spot
description: Safe place near the church and just 5min walking to center.

name: Hotel (no name)
description:
Simple hotel, good for reaching Potosi with the boat (or before taking the boat). As for us, it was too hot to keep going by bicycle so we decided to stop here. 
Standard room with private bathroom with a fan 20$ for 2 ppl.
Pet friendly. Tienda y restaurante (good fresh fish)

name: Alojamento Turistico Aguirre
description:
Simple place in a shady courtyard, 1 room for 2 pple with fan and private bathroom (2 matrimonial beds) : 600 C. 1 pers : 350 C. Pet friendly as long as your dog is well educated. Safe place to put the bicycles inside.
A bit long from the center but for 1 night is good.

name: Twinstrotters Spot
description: Large flat parking lot in the middle of a residential street. 50 cordobas at night to be safe with a guard who watches all night

name: Total Clean
description: Small laundry service. Prices are reasonable (you pay basically per piece)and they washed and dried your clothes in half a day (115c for a quite big bag of clothes).  Pricelist in the photos

name: Flor Turtle sanctuary
description:
Good place to see turtle laying and hatching. Natural birth is better after massive coming (“arribada”). Up to 7000 can come in September or octobre in 24h!!
Release is from June to January. From 17h30.

name: Seguro America
description: Nicaraguan car insurance, cost me $12 upon entry from Costa Rica

name: Cathedrale de Leon
description:
Stunning cathedral with a white roof.  That's wonderful.  With a guided tour in English or Spanish, or not.  112c per adult and 39C per child. Amazing that it wasn't on iOverlander yet.  We are really happy to have found it. 

Bring sunglasses and maybe socks, because you have to walk barefoot and the roof is really hot and bright.

name: by the Riverside
description:
very quiet place next to the river, safe (locals told us there was no problem  staying here at night) and pretty hidden from the road. we didn't like the places around the border so we found our own.

water is clean, no facilities of course. easy to find and to reach. you have to drive under the bridge, check height for  big rigs (no problem with a 3m high camper), but you can try.

to get there, coming from the border, go to the dirt road on the right side of the bridge. go down the road and turn under the bridge to cross it. keep following the path and you will find a flat area of grass, you are there !

very poor signal signal with Claro.

name: Centro turistico Laguna de apoyo
description:
We had to pay 100c for the vehicule to enter.
They give a receipt

name: Veterinario Dog's House
description: We went here to Dr. Sanchez, because our dog had two knots in her breast. The doctor did a completed checkup as well a complete blood test. After everything was done and good to go, he cut the knots out under anesthetic. After two hours the dog was fit as nothing did happen. The stitches are almost invisible, better than last time we had her stitched in Europe. Very recommended.

name: Leña Campestre
description:
la leña Campestre is a restaurant open until 6pm. as we went there, owner let us stay for free (as soon as you consulate in restaurant) for the night and use bathroom.

place is guarded at night, there is wifi and electricity. owner accepted that we add this place on ioverlander, but doesn't want to transform his restaurant in camping. therefore, he is welcoming only camper van (no tent allowed). we didn't ask for big rigs.

perfect stop before going to the delta del estero for example.

name: Delta Estero Tour
description:
When you arrive at the Estero, there are no facilities for tourism at all, don't hesitate to call Juan to organise your tour, he and his brother took care of everything : permit from marina (mandatory for tourists), tour, parking for our van during the tour, etc. total cost : 2300 córdobas (1300 for gasoline, 1000 for him, boat and logistics)

Reach out to Juan Palma, number : +505 8894 1927 (WhatsApp possible)

name: Hospedaje Hilmor
description: A simple room with bathroom, (cold shower), wifi and clean bedlinen. $15/night/room

name: emergecia amocsa
description:
we needed a little intervention and surgical help
Very nice welcome
very good doctor who speaks english

name: Street parking next to Police
description:
We Parked near the central Plaza next to a Police station. Had a very quiet night on a Friday. The Center is pretty much empty at night.
It simple street parking with no amenities.

name: Red Cross Parking
description: We parked here during our visit to Granada. Very safe and close to the centro historico. 150 C for 12h. Toilet are also avalaible.

name: ATM Lafise
description: ATM just inside the supermarket with the green sign.

name: León University. Street Parking
description:
Spend 2 quiet nights here in this street. Left the car here all day.  No problem. It’s in front of the Administration Building of the University, so there are no classes here, neither Students.
Plain street parking

name: Police checkpoint
description: There’s a bigger police checkpoint here. They looked at us but didn’t stop us because they were sitting in the shade.

name: Ostayo
description:
Bar, family restaurant in a quiet small village at the lake. with views of the two volcanoes. Free in exchange for consumption. Owner and village very kind and welcoming. Possibility to sleep on the spot. Shaded, toilet, billiards, music
 ....
Super endroit où dormir gratuit, bar, restaurant, musique, billard. propriétaire et autres très sympa et accueillant. facile d'accès. au bord du lac face aux deux volcans avec vue. super avant la frontière

name: Gear Repair “Reparación de Calzado”
description:
Small market stall that offers sewing, stitching and gear repair

I brought in several of my motorcycle bags with broken straps, and my large motorcycle boots with some tears in the leather. They stitched everything in a few hours (dropped off around 10, ready at 4) They were very thorough and the stitching looks sturdy and good. For the straps they even added new material to make them more durable. 2 bags & 1 boot repair was 600 cordoba

name: Puma Gasstation
description:
24h Gasstation. Asked for permission to stay here for the night. A good stop on the way to Laguna de Perlas or Bluefields, if you want to break the 7-8h trip.
No problem and free of charge.
As it is open 24h it is quiet loud all night. The Gasstation is right in the Center of a small village/town

name: centro de arte fundazion ortiz
description: Beautiful art museum, with central American artist and European Artis, also 2 paints from Pablo Picasso, entrance 3 us pp, a must in Leon!

name: Moto Repuesto Sanchez
description: We came here to rotate our truck tires. Very friendly and super fast work. They will take care of any problem (motor, suspension, paint work, air condition). Good price.

name: Hostal Izacalli
description:
Michel’s hotel. For 150C you can park here and spend the night. There is running water in the toilet and a cold shower. Very close to the canyon, which you can visit without a guide from here. If you want a guide, his gardener is one. 
You can enter by the back if you have a camper. ask Michel or Ariel, no problem for 3m height.
I put his card in the picture if you want to reach him first. Lovely French guy !

name: Laguna Asososca (cyclists or dirt bikes only)
description: Nice secluded lake , 3km off the main road, the road to the start of the path is pretty beaten up but doable with a loaded bicycle. To reach the lake hide your bike on the bushes and hike down for 5min. There is a canopy in case of rain and flat spots for one or two tents. There is no one there during the week, might see some visitors during the weekend. Of course no amenities so come prepared. There are some places selling water and food on the main road very close to where you go off road.

name: Finca El Jalacate Cabañas
description:
Mr. Alfredo Gutierrez, apart from his Incredible sculpturing work, has also built some cabañas for visitors to stay. Currently there are 2 available and 2 more in progress. Everything inside and outside of the cabañas has been built by him, he has also painted and decorated it. 
We did not stay for the night due to the lack of time but we had a tour inside-out provided by Don Alfredo himself. 
The cabañas have only the essentials: beds, a standing table and electricity. There's an outside shower, and there are several picnic areas around. There is also a little kiosk with drinks, snaks and souvenirs. 
Parking would be the tricky part as there is not a parking lot per say, rader parking by the side of the road (the place is also marked on iOverlander). 

The place is very rustic but you would have the essential amenities, plus it's incredibly beautiful around, the cabañas are super cute and the people are extremely friendly.

name: Hostal San Jose
description: Super nice Hostal/hotel with little garden courtyard, free breakfast and secure parking. The parking is half a block from the place but it’s a large lot at his cousins place. The owner is super kind and they have great reviews on google maps. It was $17 for a private room. You can also book a tour of Somoto Canyon with them which was really fun. You basically swim through the Canyon waters as part of the hike so make sure your outfit and shoes are good to completely go swimming. They provide life jackets and there’s a lunch but I skipped the lunch. Tour was $20 and I think lunch was $4. It was super nice

name: Perfect remote beach
description:
As we found the offer in iOverlander of wild camping spots on this coast insufficient, here is one great.

No bars, no fake guards and other "property etc. owners", one big nothing around. Not a single house, sign, gate, nothing. Noone will bother you.

Last 30m are deep sand, but you can anytime give up and just stay where you are.

name: Restaurant Parguito Rojo
description:
100 Cordoba/camper/night. Good restaurant with reasonable prices. Beach access. Clean Toilets. They have a guard for the night. 
Be careful with the soft sand, we (Citroen Jumper, like a Promaster) needed help from our friends to get out of the soft sand. 
They told us that the Restaurant opened 3 weeks ago, campers and overlanders are very welcome!

name: Casa Única / Benjamin House
description:
Casa Única has space for 2 vans who can sleep in the parking lot. It has 2 cabins also available on Airbnb if you ever look for a little comfort. Benjamin offered us toilet, shower, electricity, kayaks, and Wi-Fi for $ 10 pp. The garden is a real heaven of peace with a superb deck and even a BBQ.

The place is private so don’t hesitate to ring the bell! 
Speak English, French & Spanish

name: Finca Estancia
description: Great restaurant in the middle of nowhere it seems, good variety of very reasonably priced dishes. Recomended!

name: Nahualapa‘z
description:
A little oasis at the Pacific Ocean. Under the shade of palmtrees you may camp, rest under palapas or in the hammock. Harry , the French owner, is a very warm and welcoming guy. Also a restaurant with excellent local food is on site. Quiet at night, perfect clean toilets and showers.

Only con is no WiFi.

name: Room to roam
description: cool hotel in a cool little surf town.right near every thing you need and across the street from the beach. English is spoken here. hot water and WiFi available full bar restaurant . rv parking also available nearby.

name: Islands Boat Tour
description:
Here you can rent a boat to take the tours around the islands. You can have a stop at a restaurant or just cruise around and see monkeys.
$20 for an hour (with 2 hours you get a very good impression.)

name: Amazing family
description: We couldnt find any good pull out, so gave up and started asking locals if we can stay in front of their house. Tjis family welcomed us with all the warm that could be possible. We asked them if we should register them in iOverlander and they said yes, so you are welcome to come here and camp over night. Highle recomended on the way to Waspam, or Bonanza.

name: Suniawas Community
description: There is a great chance if you ask at any house in the Suniwas community that they will let you sleep on their property, the shared area around the church. There are no cars in Suniwas and the road to Mosawas was too much for us as the tracks by the bus are too deep and too wide so we hit the stones with our  suspension and finally gave up. Mosawas community is the end of the road and it is a stunning remote indigenous community. Highly recommended.

name: Truck stop
description:
Saw this place as we were headed to Costa Rica. Had to find a break in the median to turn around (near the military zone). After turning around it was right before the round about. (Making it easy to turn back around in the morning)
After turning in, to a big bumpy lot, someone came and collected 50 cordobas ($1.36USD). 
Just another truck stop. Felt safe.

name: River spot
description: Nice spot by the river next to small dead end road, locals passing by in the evenong, but very quiet and felt safe. There are not many places to stop by the road from Siuna, so this was much above average. Recomended.

name: Playa Peru
description:
Right next to the lake, you can sleep here for free. We have our own jayak so didn’t go to the rental shop but the lady from the house told us it was ok to sleep here.
You can see a lot of birds and howler monkeys. View and sunset is amazing

name: Finca Nakili
description: 5 cabanas room for tents very friendly,nice veiw of the bay.

name: Paraiso Hostel
description: Adding this place for people that only look at campspots and filter out hostel. It is a very nice place to stay and not to be missed as an option around the lake. See more comments and details on the hostel pin.

name: Parking La Colonia
description: This La Colonia supermarket has a tap just out front of the main entrance (on a small grassy area by the parking area). friendly guard said it is potable and encouraged us to refill 20L container at no cost. has a thread for a hose but best to ask the guard first before refilling.

name: Plastic and fiberglass repair
description:
Broke a hole in one of my plastic boxes. Brought it here for repair. The guy fixed it like new. 

When asked about payment, he said "Pay me what you like." Ugh. I gave him C400.

name: Cafe Museo Mirador
description: Wonderful cafe with museum and shop. Fab home cooked food. Coffee. Fresh juices etc. Also mirador overlooking the lake and volcano at the rear. Super friendly owners

name: In front of the church
description: Between park and church. Since in the other post it was written that the guard doesn't like to overnight in the park side. We parked just in front, some locals sleep also in this side of the street in hammocks(attached to the church fence and car). Just the mass in the church start 6am so around 5:30 it was the calling with the big bells. Good alarm to go to the border.

name: SIM - claro
description:
Buy SIM card CLARO here. Try to arrive before 4pm
Only cash but you can pay with USD.

name: Güirilas
description: Stop here for fresh güirilas, a local sweet specialty.

name: Beach el Rosario
description: Very nice spot near the beach. Quiet and direct access to the beach. Need a 4x4 to get there. Super sunset. We recommend

name: Joséline laundry
description: Joséline is a lady who hand washes the laundry. Very nice family. 250C (about 5kg) laundry recovered the same day

name: Truck Stop
description:
We arrived here at 9:30pm because of the music at the other stop.
Truck stop with guard for 50 Córdoba per véhicule. 

Didn’t ask for toilets but they haven’t water available.

name: Break-in while parked on street
description: We parked here while we went for lunch, just on the street, and came back to all doors locked and normal… Drove to the place we are camping for the night and realized our camp stove and fire extinguisher was missing. Also a Canadian Goodlife Gym duffel bag (I guess to carry the stove and extinguisher! But had some clean undies in there). They obviously didn’t spend more than a few minutes in there because nothing else was touched. We are lucky! Just be careful, make sure valuables are somewhere hard to get to and nothing is visible. They did also leave their keys on our counter so hopefully they are feeling some karma?

name: OUTDOOR DEPOT
description:
Tons of camping gear! Travel mugs, travel accessories, fishing, golfing, sports, etc. 
Came here after our Coleman stove got stolen out of the van and found one after searching many other Walmart’s and stores like it.

name: SINSA - basically Home Depot!
description: Equivalent to Home Depot… big parking lot

name: bar and restaurant
description: Very nice place to eat and drink a really good coffee. Try guirilla, another kind of tortilla, with cheese mayo and gallo pinto! Very reccomended

name: Las Estrellas Hotel
description: If you need a place for the night this is perfect. The rooms are small but clean with toilet inside, safe parking and very close to a restaurant. A double room for 300 cordoba. Reccomended

name: El Padre
description: Flat tire repair and tire inflation for motorcycle and cars/camper etc..

name: Hotel Zoy
description:
Simple but cute place. I paid C400 for one person. Room has a fan, TV, and private bathroom with electric shower. There is a comfortable outdoor courtyard. Wifi is a bit slow.

There is a restaurant on site, but no meals are provided with the room. 

Gated parking area has room for about four cars.

name: Julia Comedor
description:
Very nice comedor. Try the burrito, so delicious with tasty vegetables.
A plate is 180-220c.

name: Pan de vida. Bakery
description: Really nice and tasty bakery. Really Cookies and Bread baking in oven. Chocolate cake! Great. Price is honest. Love it! The place is great. To have lunch! Posât, burgers, salad….

name: Hostal Ola Azul
description:
Hostal that offers in parking lot campsite for cars, vans, campers..
Swimming pool, shower and bathroom, restaurant and bar. 
Direct access to the beach.
Quiet and night.
We paid 15usd/2 pers, with access to all amenities.

name: Police Checkpoint
description: Today we got stopped and they asked for passport, driver license, insurance, TIP, vehicle papers. We gave them only copies and were glad that we did. He also asked us where we are going. He was super unfriendly and tried to convince us that our insurance isn’t correct. But we repeated passionately that the border checked our insurance (they didn’t) and that they accepted it. After a few minutes he got tired trying to find a reason to charge a fee. Our Spanish is bad and we are glad that this time we were lucky. Be aware, the police seems to be as corrupt as in Mexico.

name: La casa del filtro
description:
So glad we found this place. Here, you can find any kind of filters, air, oil, diesel, gasoline. The staff is so nice, I was looking for my filters (oil & diesel from europe)since a long time and the staff was very helpful, looking for equivalent during half hour, and finally they found it. They have also all kind of oil. 
I really recommend this place for all travelers with car or RV from europe or anywhere. good prices also

name: Uno lubricants
description:
For oil change and lubs.
Just behind the gas station Uno, they have a work shop where you can fit RV easy. They are so nice, the girl from the office is very smily and helpful. Workers are very nice.
oil change cost me 100C, I provided oil and filters that I found a "la casa del filtro" (see other spot in Managua).
they also lubs all the chassis for jus a tip (I gave 200C because it was so cheap and they were so nice)

name: Restaurante El Caiman
description:
Nice camping in the parking lot or garden of a family restaurant. Their speciality is firewood oven pizzas.

The place has clean bathroom, very good wifi covering all the site, an amazing view to the Volcano Conception and sunset.

We paid 5usd for the car and 2 people.

Possibility to rent kayaks, with guide if needed.

If you camp on the parking lot you might not feel totally comfortable during the day, as people come and go. Prefer the garden of you stay more days.

It is a good spot for a night.

name: Coffee Museum
description: Small Coffee Museum.  Free to enter and really intresting even if you don't like coffee.  Info is in both Spanish and English. Tourist agent and coffee shop on site

name: El Primo , Leon
description: The place is being established by „el primo“, Ulises, could be ready in a few days or weeks. will be basic but close to Leon (15min by taxi). Right now it is not ready yet. it’s just an empty lot. Call Ulises whatsapp 89575522 for updates.

name: Restaurante Mirador Momotombo
description:
The restaurant is closed at the moment but Alfredo the owner is okay with people camping here. Ask Francisco the caretaker to open the gate to a small paradise. 

There is water and a toilet. 

Maybe we can help Alfredo to get his business back up running here after Covid

name: hostel la gloria
description: hostel la gloria, cheap accommodation 5usd pp for a dorm, 10usd for a private room, well priced comedor. offered us to camp for free if we ate from the comedor, beautiful view of the lake. WhatsApp +50581616778

name: casa Delia's
description: Very nice and clean colonial house where you can rest out of the noise of the touristic places, even if they are very close. The owner Delia is very nice and her family too. A double room with private bathroom is 30 usd per night. The rooms are at the first floor, wood everywhere, and the house ia full of history. Very reccomended. There is no parking for cars but the parked 2 motoebikes inside.

name: Yankee beach
description: About a mile off the highway next to the gated community of Vista del mar the dirt road ends at the care takers houses/farm. The beach is about a 300 yard/ mtr walk (there is walking beach access but not driving).   During the day there is limited parking but emptyies out at night. Safe out of the way spot. Nice beach

name: Hardware store ACE - sinsa
description: Hardware store where you can find a lot of tools

name: Photocopia - Trans Nica
description: Good place to do the print of paper work before the border

name: Manta Raya Hospedaje
description:
Very nice place to relax and spent some days in front of the ocean. It is in one of the last villages before the border. The rooms are clean and very nice, the food simple but really good... Fresh fish is available of course!
It is just in front a beautiful peaceful beach.
1 room for 2 people is 25 usd.. Very reccomended

name: Camping next to Laguna Masaya
description:
Great place for wild camping, big flat area, Safe, 200 mts from the Road. 
Nice place to stay more than 1 night 
The very begining of the place colud need 4x4 as it is sandy and there is like a “step”

name: Poneloya Beach. Free
description: The beach has a lot of entrances from the main road, some of them with sand, some with grass. We came on a Sunday and it was really calm just some people on the restaurants area. No facilities but really refreshing after the hot in León. Price: free

name: lake side clearing & beach
description:
We were going to go to the other place next to this, but it seemed that it was cut off with road works, so we continued down a nother little bit and seen a dirt road leading towards the lake. Great little spot a few flat places to park up. we arrived on a Sunday and there were a few families chilling and swimming. there were a couple police guys that were walking by, and they had no issues with us staying here. we had the place to ourselves after 6 pm. Really chilled spot, and the temps seem to be great.
road leading to the turnoff was fantastic, really well graded and smooth. We're driving a for transit, and we had loads of room to manoeuvre at the site, so I'm sure larger campers won't have too much hassle, as long as you aren't over 4m's high. We have 4g claro signal

name: Centro touristico Pochomil
description:
Big parking area next to beach access, a public bus parking, big rig friendly. Free with guard at the entrance.
Many restaurants nearby, on weekends popular with Nicuaraguans but not overcrowded due to the amount of space.

name: Hospital Vivian Pellas
description:
Large General Hospital ( private) with numerous clinics and Emergency Room. 
Good parking for all size rigs at the premises. Our treatment was first class and instant ( Shoulder issue ) Very professional but you need to check the cost before treatment . Recommended

name: Water tap at Walmart
description: There is an easy to park water tap at Walmart with nice water pressure and cold water. Dont know if its drinking water, but it looks clear

name: Two water taps (a local said its drinkable)
description: There are two water tap with easy parking possibility

name: Puerto El Rayo
description:
We found this place and what a Gem. It's a small little port with loads of room to park right next to the lake. It has a fantastic view of the volcano, and you can hear plenty of howling monkeys.
We asked the Tienda / with a pool if we could park here l, they said no problem, however asked for 100 c's for the van for a night. It's super safe here plenty of room for big as well, however the road can be rough at some locations, but just take your time and maneuver between the bigger ruts. 2wd no issues at all. Might get a bit muddy, slippery during rainy season

name: Treehuggers
description:
Treehuggers can organize tours in the miraflores reservation. You can book a guide or contact a finca to find a place to stay.
We paid 39$ for the guide (30$ plus 9$ for hiking through private land) for 2 adults & 2 kids.
Appointment was in finca fuente de la vida where we slept.

name: Finca Fuente de la vida
description:
Nice finca to stay in Miraflores reservation.
From here we took a hike with Rodolfo (booked by Treehuggers).
Nice owner that can make a traditionnal meal for you.
Bathroom and cold shower.
We didn't ask for water
10$/night/vehicle
15$ for the meal (2 adults &2 kids)
Pretty cool at night cause you're at 1400m.
We drove by the dirt road from Esteli.
Pretty long (1h30 for 25km) and rocky but non difficulties (we are with an european RV 24ft and 2 RWD).
Beware of the northeast entrance. There is a rio to pass, and we had to turn around because it was too steep for us.
No claro signal. 2 bars Tigo. Movistar shall works

name: Seguro para El auto
description:
We’ve cross the border and nobody told us about the obligatory insurance, and we saw it on iover that the police are corrupt and they can charge penalty if you don’t have it. So we asked for locals help and luckily we’ve found this place and we could make it here and keep travelling. Same price from the border. 
Is good to make a copy of all car documents and of the license to in case the police take it from you. 
--
Cruzamos a fronteira por Guasale e não falaram do seguro obrigatório em nenhum momento. Chegamos em Leon e começamos a ler os comentários no iover e vimos que é obrigatório. Rodamos a cidade e conseguimos ajuda com um local que nos trouxe até aqui para fazer o seguro.  Mesmo valor da fronteira.

name: Assados local food
description:
Local restaurant, with BBQ and local food. Very cheap. Ask for Box (60 cordobá ), With gallo pinto, meet, salad and tortilla. 
The BBQ is 150 Cordobas. You can add more food as well. Nice and friendly staff. 

Restaurante bem local, comida barata e bastante. O BX é o equivalente ao nosso PF.
Uma carne 60 cordobas se quiser pode add mais e pagar extra. O BBQ é 150 cordobas. 
Bom e barato.

name: Marina Cocibolca
description:
Parking lot inside Marina. Secure & quiet. Lot of people on weekend. There is a restaurant not too expensive with lake view.
You can do boat tours from here.
We did kayak 'cause we've our own : very nice tour in the Isletas.
300C/night
You can go in Granada by taxi (we paid 120C)

name: Backside of the cathedral
description: At the back side of the Cathedral and at the same time in front of the entrance to the central market.  Almost level public parking-lot, busy, always really noisy but perfect for us to visit Leon and to see the Palm Sunday procession.  Give the guides (the ones with the yellow jackets) one dollar a day and one a night and you will have no problem and they will respect you and look after your vehicle.  Right in the center, delicious street kitchens right next door in the evening.  We stayed here two nights without any problems.

name: Opposite Bar Apoyo Beach
description: We came there in the Easter week, of course everything was very crowded, found this place by chance. Attention! The entrance opposite the "Bar Apoyo Beach“ to which the spot belongs, is really very steep, you need high clearance, but if you can do it, it’s perfect! Space for minimum 3 rigs. We had it for ourselves. You stand on top flat like on a terrace, next to palm trees and flowers with great few over the lake and a cool breeze. There are even more parking spaces below and beside, that are not so steeply accessible but also much more unleveled. The original price was 200 Córdobas per night for two people and one car but we negotiated it to 150 and stayed for 3 nights. There is a bar / restaurant and you can use the tables and hammocks on the beach for free. The lagoon is fantastic for swimming. The toilets are very rustic but ok and there is free weak WiFi. Slow Claro signal as well. Probably one of the cheapest ways to stay at the lagoon if you can manage the entrance.

name: Opposite iglesia La Merced
description:
Free street parking in front of the hotel opposite of the entrance from the church. 
Busy during the day but quiet at night. In the center of Grenada. Stayed here without any problems for one night. Gave a few Cordobas to the watch-man in front of the church.

name: Street Parking. Iglesia Nuestra Senora de Guadelupe
description: Best place for visiting Granada! Free public parking with many flat spots directly beside the church. Quiet at night, felt absolutely safe. Very close to the Malecon as well as to the cathedral and the center. Next door is Hotel La Calzada with the Hogs Breath Saloon, a very nice bar with great music, very good food and fair rates. It‘s run by Sean ,a very nice Canadian guy, and his Nicaraguan wife and their whole staff is very friendly too. He likes talking to Overlanders and knows almost everything about living in Nicaragua. Have a coffee or some food or drinks on their shady terrace and you can use their wifi and clean toilets during your stay. They also offer nice rooms with fair rates and a little pool. Many other restaurants, bars and shops close bye along Calle La Calzada. Highly recommended!

name: Volcano divers
description:
Want to dive in a volcanic lake?  Then this is the place to do it.

Lake dives are normal cold, poor viz, and nothing to see.  This was not any of that.  I was surprised by the fish life and had fun playing in the thermal vents.  Well worth the $35usd.  William was great and very safety conscious.  Highly recommended.

name: Cocos bar
description: Cocos Bar and hostel. Wi-Fi : cocos bar  password: <passwords not allowed>.

name: BANPRO
description: ATMs machines at the entrance of the shopping center and also one at the bank. You can get local currency and US dollars. $4 dollars commission for the transaction

name: River crossing
description: A bit of a spicy crossing on a motorcycle. Not very deep when I was there, but large rocks made it a close one for me. Safe travels!

name: Hotel and Pizzeria Waslala
description: Great little place. Clean and quiet with very secure parking inside the building.

name: Beachfront Playa El Ostional
description: If you have 4WD follow the dirt road until the end, pass all the restaurants and bars on the left side, then you can enter this wonderful beach and find the best place right on the solid sand. Just be careful, water is coming up very far at high tide. But it’s a perfect lonely place, beach is clean and water perfect for swimming. No shade. Monkeys in the trees behind the beach wake you up with their crying in the morning. Cheap rates for drinks at the bars close bye. No people around even on Sunday. Only a few fishermen and some cows on the beach. No services but for us one of the dream-beach-places of Nicaragua, we stayed 3 nights on the way to cross the border to Costa Rica.

name: Torno Jexpra
description:
A metalworking workshop where they fixed the part the mechanic down the road couldn't replace swiftly, cheaply and effectively. They also repaired the jack I've been trying to replace or repair for months, including visits to any number of similar workshops in Mexico; big relief to having a working one of those again! Took around an hour and they were meticulous with the work and fair in the pricing; charged me 400 cordobas. 

Incidentally there's also a glass/window place on the corner opposite where I found the glue necessary to fix up my rearview mirror, which had fallen off in the 40⁰ heat on the El Salvador/Honduras border. Took a couple of minutes and charged just 50 cordobas for the privilege.

name: Hostal Cisne House
description: This is a simple hostel with room. we paid $30.The owner Frankie can speak good English and very friendly. has shower but no Aircon

name: NN-45
description: Do not take NN-45 without 4x4, additional features and high clearance. It has very rocky and steep sections

name: Tourist Information
description: Tourist Information is open Monday through Friday

name: Complejo de Piscinas Michele Richardson
description:
Big pools for swimming and showers. It‘s 3 USD or 110 Cordobas for one hour. 
Opening hours see photo.

name: ProRider Esteli bikes
description: Decent bike shop that has more mountain bike parts but they might potentially be able to find parts from elsewhere. I had to change a 27.5 rim and i think they got one from Managua.

name: Uno Fuel Station
description: Small fuel station. The owner very kindly let us stop the night at the side of his building. not very level but OK for one or two vehicles. The station shuts at 10pm but had a guard on premises all night.

name: Abandoned Hotel Car Park
description: large open car park in front of an abandoned hotel just off the road. No problems, but a little bit of traffic noise

name: Parqueo del Cementerio
description: Large free parking area for all kinds of vehicles. Little shade. Quiet at night until ...5:30 AM when all activities begin in this hot city. Security at the cemetery's entrance.
