name: Mirador Cosigüina
Mirador Apoyeque
description: Great place for camping. there are a lot of spot to put the tent or where to park the car. night are quite and relaxing, just a bit windy after de sun set. There was a trail to go down to the lake, but was not available because the plant closed the way(the guard told me that the machine to clean the path was broken). The guard is there 24h. There is water for drinking and for showers, also toilets. The price is just a donation, I gave 120cordobas and I think it was ok for the guard. The sunset was the best. Just be careful with the ticks and Scorpions, I saw a few(in theory only in the rainy season they said). The way to arrive is quite okay, perfect for moto or car, not sure for caravane because some parts where a bit steep.

name: Hospital Veterinarios Asociados 1
description: Super friendly Vet that helped us with our Rabies FAVN test (235$/ 8577,50NIO) to get our dog to Europe. Our dog liked both Doctors and there staff straight away, even she is a easy scared dog. They offer many services and speak good English. We had a really good feeling when we left. Also they sell Nextgar SPECTRA. The Vet has a second office/Hospital Carretera a Masaya. If you have any questions you can contact the Vet via WhatsApp +505 8966 5220

name: Cafetería Estación Jessie
description: Here you can try two different types of coffee one sun dried with its skin and one with out my advised is to try both, they also grow their own coffee from finca los PONCHOS.

name: Cafetería Estacion Jessie
description: We stayed here one night after talking with the owner they told us no problem to stay here and they let us used the bathrooms we had breakfast the next morning their coffee is amazing 40 córdobas and the breakfast was 80 córdobas they also sell insurance if you missed it at the border crossing.

name: Popotlan Restaurant and cheese store
description: One of the best breakfast I had in a while with fresh cheese the owner Mealin she milks her own cows every morning. She was super friendly and well educated she worked for a Non profit before opening her own restaurant. Best cheese in the area.

name: Cabañas Rusticas
description: Patrick and Roxanne are a very friendly Canadian couple who own this lovely place and rent cabanas. They accept vans for 10 USD. Very clean toilets and showers, shared kitchen, possibility to buy beer, soda, juice on site. The place is very quiet at night. Within walking distance of all restaurants, bars and the beach. Not for big rigs. No animals because Gaston the owners' dog is according to the owners not very friendly with the other animals entering "his" place (but very nice with the guests). The owners also prefer not to have children on site. Highly recommended!

name: Volcán entrance
description:
Best wild camping in Nicaragua! The road is good for every car, we managed with a 2wd van. From here is 30m hike to arrive to the top of the volcano!
No rubbish around!

name: Hostal Libertad
description: Nice hotel close to the central square and supermarkets. about 30 USD for s single spacious room with good wifi, AC and including breakfast. I was able to park my motorcycle at the secured front porch and there is also a 24 hour security guard in the night.

name: Cento Turistico Xiloa
description:
Robbed at 2 pm in a secured and fenced touristic park. 3 guys with knifes and machetes entered our van when we prepared for swimming. 200m next to a restaurant with guests, 5 min after a family passed us, 50 m next to us some workers slept in their van.
Lost smartphones, wallet, headlights and other stuff.

name: Police Station Laguna de Perlas
description:
After arriving in Laguna de Perlas we talked to the police about how safe it is and where to stay in a car.
They told us we could park and camp right next to the station / in front of Casa de Cultura on the grass.
They said that LdP is in general very safe, only Raitipura is a difficult neighborhood (on the way to Awas).
We ended up sleeping here and it was quiet, safe and the police building even provided shade in the morning. 
my girlfriend walked around alone at night and felt safe.

We came here during Christmas, main season is march to may we were told.
The town itself is not spectacular (but poor), but it's interesting for the Misquito/Garifuna/Creole-Culture and a port to start boat rides to the Pearl Islands and other places around. 

The road from El Rama to here is probably the best road in Nicaragua.

name: Dr. Akri orthopedic
description: We had an issue with my shoulder and got referred to this doctor by world of mouth the whole town knows him and he is a very professional orthopedic he even performs surgeries abroad. he is also a motorcycle traveler and a 4x4 hard core enthusiast. he even invited us to stay in his house and used their bathroom an shower. But we had other cross the border.

name: Salud Digna laboratories
description: We got sick in Nicaragua and had to do a complete lab work (adult paquete for 12 usd), an x-ray (6usd) and an ultra sound (7usd) we walk right in paid with a credit card. Get there early in the morning to avoid large crowds they open 7am

name: Autostar
description: Perfect place, nice lady-manager  who speaks English, good staff, price ok, repair alternator Fuso and changing tires MAN.  Good for Trucks, enough space for parking. Walmart walking distance. Mercedes-Benz, Fuso, Dodge, Jeep, but difficult to get spare parts.

name: Friendly family
description:
On our way back from Laguna de Perlas we were looking for a place to stay the night. 
Found this friendly family with a big grassy spot in front of their house, quite and flat.
They were interested in learning about other cultures and we spent a nice evening talking and listening to music. 
They will welcome other overlanders. Bathroom/shower might be available, we didn't ask. 
Good place to stay one night.

name: Parking close to the little harbour
description:
A big flat parking area close to the harbor where tou can take a boat to cross the river. We parked here to visit the CarpeDiem project and the surfing turtle lodge which both deserves a visit. The parking was fenced and gated and is the backyard of a family. The is no guards or camera at night but they have dogs. Its opposite to a lot of restaurants which might add a bit of security. The price was 100 Cordobas per night. 
I thought to put this place as currently there is no safe parking option in Las Peñitas and several people mentioned they have had or felt some security issues.
Also the guy running the boat service offered us to park in his garden for the same price (which is not visible from the road and has a higher fence and might be even more secure) but we couldnt enter due to a big bump at the property entrance (we would have touched ground with our sanitary pipe).

name: ARMED ROBBERY at the end of Playa Hermosa
description:
Be careful!! We did a beach walk at Playa Hermosa which was really nice. We walked to Playa las Tablas and on our way back over the rocks to Playa Hermosa an armed guy with a machete came out of nowhere and crossed our way. 

We had to knee down and had to give him all of our money. He said to me (girlfriend) that I should go and leave my boyfriend alone with him… but we staid together, god knows what he wanted to do??? In the end he searched our whole bag and opened everything. Luckily he didn’t take our phones and the camera.

name: Dr Bird Bar & Grill
description:
What a find! A very friendly restaurant with a strong Jamaican flavour! A broad menu with varieties of chicken, pork and goat to choose from, all at very moderate prices … and the servings are such that you dont leave hungry.
We came twice and enjoyed the open court yard with lots of plants, where tables are wide apart.
It is not the most spediest of all services, but this is probably also an indication that the food is freshly prepared.

name: Estación de Bomberos
description: chilled and quite place during the night and right next to the Bomberos and the lake. beautiful view and lots of birds. We asked the fireman and they said it's fine to sleep here. Some fisherman in the morning and the Bomberos start playing music at 7 am. claro works fine. the Bomberos have electricity and toilets but we didn't ask if we can use their facilities.

name: water faucet
description: Water seems to be here, working, taste ok. Nobody to ask.

name: Zoo Parking Lot
description: Free parking for Zoo. Attendants watch over car while you go. When we came back we asked them if we could camp here and if it was safe and they said yes no problem. It seems everyone tips the attendee about 20C. Parking Spots are short. We are 2.4m and we’re right on the edge. Width doesn’t matter. Zoo closes at 5 so After everyone leaves I’m sure you could set up a tent.  Dark and quiet all night. Felt very safe. We also heard Lions roar at night which was awesome!

name: mina de oro Santo Domingo
description: A town where you can visit gold mine. beautiful town.

name: Aguas termales Piscinas La Coca
description: 2 pools, no shower, toilet, you can have a drink (no food).

name: banos thermales la Coca
description: 10$/camper/night, pool access 50 cordobas/children and 70 cordobas/adult

name: Playa Casa de Tejas
description: Small bay beach in a secluded place. You can reach here on a tall vehicle not necessarily 4x4.

name: Hospital
description: Medical centre near the Costa Rice border. Staff were friendly although there was a bit of a long wait!

name: Hostal Las Mochilas
description: nice hostel with kind owners. 8$ pp. a dormitory with private bathroom + a swimming pool and a shared kitchen. Nothing to complain about ! I recommend !

name: Taller de Mecánico Payo
description:
We were in a tight spot after our van wouldn't start at the am:pm. These guys helped us out to solve the pretty simple/quick problem, but then tried to charge us too much. 

Definitely worth knowing they're there along with another mechanic over the road if you're stuck, but I wouldn't necessarily recommend to go there if you can avoid it.

name: Cancha Municipal
description:
Looking for a place to sleep and not much places around in this region.
Asked the local police checkpoint and they pointed to this big municipal square.
Lots of place in the shade and whole square is illuminated during the night.
Next to the square sits the local securidad guy and ask permission to stay for the night.
It was okay for us and the place is safe and feels very good.
Some road noise, but dies after 9 pm.
There are picnic tables and there seems to be a washroom with toilets and sink in the municipal building, but we didn’t checked this out.
Safe and free !

name: La Sirenita
description:
La Sirenita is run by Lukas (German) and his nica wife. 
It's a quite place right at the beach with sunset and volcano view and 1min from famous Mango Beach (very good food!). 

They just got a road to connect to the main road and are still working on it - right now it's a little narrow get there by car, but that should improve soon. 2WD and low clearance was ok. Car parking is shaded, tent camping close to the beach. 

Camping is 3$pP, Cabañas (sleep two) right at the beach are 18$ (book via Airbnb). 
Shower (cold) and Bathroom (water flush) are simple but we'll maintained. Kitchen well equipped and they also sell beer for cheap. 

If you need a scooter, want to explore the island or have questions about Ometepe, they will happily assist you with all their knowledge and connections. 
Dogs, ducks, chicken, and occasionally horses roam the land and give a good nica vibe.
We highly recommend to stay here!

The wifi is good, claro weak.

name: Lavandería Navarette
description:
María Luisa Navarette is doing an amazing and quick job. Your cloth is super clean and smells good when return. It takes one day. She is doing all your laundry at her house for a fair price. 100$C for 12 pieces. Big things count as two pieces. if you like she is also doing pick up and delivery service for 60$C. We were staying in Popoyo and still paid the same pick up price. 

Best is to what's app her ahead. +505 8784 2245. if you want to drop your laundry at her house, best is to park at the main road, next to the Comedor Navarette, and walk the little dirt road till the end, 2nd house on the right.

name: Mecánico Oliver Flores
description: After we arrived at the island, our brakes were not functional any more. Hydraulic problem. Oliver was our first help "emergency mechanic". The location is right across the road to the new church, and for big rigs it's a bit tricky. So best is to park right in front along the road. Oliver is really friendly, only Spanish speaking and could fix our problem. For 2hrs of work, he asked for 200$C. His mechanic garage is really tiny, so for bigger problems it is better to go somewhere else. But perfect for quick fix. His whats app +505 8228 3607

name: Comedor Buen Sazon
description: Great local food experience. Traditional, fresh and delicious and if you want fast food they have it too. Price is very convenient and they have a good variety of recipes

name: Casa Mauro
description: this place is a proper Hostel, in the parking lot there is room for at least four 4x4 cars where you can camp, there is a shower, running water restrooms and most important, an small bar

name: Camping Salinas Somoto Canyon
description: Really nice small camping spot along the Somoto Canyon River. Popular with locals. Simple amenities of bucket toilet, covered sitting area, access to river, firepit. No power, No Wi-Fi. Cellular reception is good. 5km to Honduras border.  Turn off the main road at the sign (see photo with Somoto Canyon sign), you will drive down a dirt path for about 1 km before you reach the camp site.  Contact Mr. Salinas to reserve +505 5716 3596

name: El Boquete
description:
Nice and almost clean beach with a lot of trees which spend some shadow. in Daytime only a view locals show up and you are mostly alone. blue water sand and rocky beach, as well as water entry. perfect. The Lake water is quite salty, but theres a small river, if you walk up a bit the water is fresh and good to use for drinking. (purified or boiled) 
the road is good to access but sure bumby, bug rigs might not get here because of the trees.

loads of howling monkeys.

name: Eco Lodge y Restaurante Blue Morpho
description: Small Hotel/Restaurant/Campsite run by a German/Nicaraguan couple.  5 rooms, prices between $30 and $70 for 1-4 people.  All details can be seen online and reserved on their homepage.  (Can be found via Google Maps.)

name: Eco Lodge y Restaurante Blue Morpho
description:
Small Hotel/Restaurant/Campsite run by a German/Nicaraguan couple.
Meat, fish, burgers, beer...

name: Ometepe Zipline Tour
description:
Nice Zipline/Canopy-Tour for 20$pP. 

It‘s the cheapest Zipline in Central America they say….(?).

Honestly they don’t do much explanation, but we are beginners and everything was totally fine. 

Enjoy :)

name: ATM - banco LAFISE
description: Two ATMs at Banco LAFISE Bancentro. Perfect location.

name: Near beach under trees
description: Nice private place next to ocean under trees.

name: Rancho Maribel
description:
Restaurant. Maribel runs the place.
You can park next to the resto or inside. Safe place, friendly people. Free... if you eat at the resto.

name: handmade brick factory
description:
La Paz is a city and area where bricks are made from dirt in a very artisanal process. There are plenty of little factories along this road.
No guides, no tours, no entrance, no tickets… just go to meet one of them ! This one here was very nice and explained a lot to us while molding bricks.

name: Maxi Pali
description: Super market where you can buy food. It’s like a very small Walmart. Some fruits and veggies, yogourt, etc…

name: Flaingo Hotel & Restaurant
description: Very friendly owner and locked gate parking. Hotel rooms awailable. Good food.

name: Pachamama Camping
description: Asked from gate for a camping place for tents. Paid $10 for 3 tents and a car. Some cows and horses around.

name: Vibe de Dois: Olívia Peluquera Perros
description:
Olívia bathes and cuts the hair of dogs in her home. White House on the corner. She charged $20 dollars for the bath and grooming. Your WhatsApp is: +505 8752 6340
__________________________

Olívia dá banho e corta o pelo de cães na sua casa. Casa Branca da esquina. Cobrou $20 dólares pelo banho e tosa. Seu WhatsApp é: +505 8752 6340

name: Puma Gas Station
description:
There's a water spigot that was allowed to used to filled up my tank. It is right next to a big metal water tank that says " AGUA POTABLE". Just ask the guys and they'll help you out.
Low pressure, took forever but gets the job done

name: Puma Gas Station
description: Stayed at this Puma Gas Station on my way to Leon as it was getting late. The guys accommodated me in between trucks. There's a Super 7 cafe offering food, wifi and restrooms. A little noisy but all good.

name: La Colonia
description: Grocery store with relative wide range, including imported products.

name: Sonda water tap
description: Bought a few things at Sinsa and asked the security guards if I could fill up my truck camper. They said no problem that it was for customers but I'm sure they will let you use it anyways.

name: by the church
description: We stayed here for one night.  Quiet street beside the church.  Usual plaza in front of the church. no facilities but quiet.

name: Huge parking lot by the lake
description: we stayed here at this parking lot and field.  it's quiet for the night. no one bothered us.  there is a cool breeze from the lake.

name: Taller de Mecanica carper
description: Very professional place for all works on Toyotas. Not too expensive, does have the possibility to get all spare parts. Does know about his works. The employees are really great and friendly, not speaking English much.

name: PALI
description: Pali supermarket with everything you need (mostly) fruits, veggies, toilet paper, etc…

name: La Cueva del Grifo Loco
description:
Hostel with space for one rig. Decent shower and bathroom with a nice space to hang out and rooftop area perfect for yoga. ~5 min walk to the beach. Owner Adriano is an italian chef with a super kind heart. He can tell you all about the area, including where you can free camp if you’d rather do that and just shower here. We planned to just stay a day but ended up staying 5 😊 super dog friendly, Adriano even watched our two dogs for us while we left for a few hours

Paid 200 C pp to stay and ~100-220 C for delicious scratch made italian meals

name: CASH at RM Somotillo
description:
If you need cash, here at the RM E/S Somotillo Edgar will happily charge your card inside for cash back. 

With 40 cordobas as a very small fee. 

The closest bank / ATM is roughly 70 km or 50 miles from here. Long way to drive if you do not have enough or any cash to buy insurance.

name: Aguas agrias
Peaceful, Breezy Lake and Volcano Views
description:
7 minutes from the border. There is a pin on the map (Ostayo) it is possibly to also camp there at the bar and restaurant in exchange for consumption. 

Or if you like, take a short left and drive 20 feet down to the beach. Sand is quite packed and there is a path as far as you like to drive. Zero issues. 

One man comes in the morning and possibly in the evening to collect his 3 cows. Sometimes with his sons. Super kind 

Peaceful. Quiet. Constant breeze all night. Beautiful sunset and clear view of the two volcanoes. 

Zero trash. Please keep it clean.

name: Farmacia Clínica María Inmaculada
description:
The best pharmacy I have encountered in all of Central America. Friendly staff, very patient and helpful. 

I was easily able to stock up on all 3 of my dogs medications — even his seizure medication that is a narcotic. 

Ask for your needed medication at the main counter. They will print you a slip you go to the both labeled CAJA. Hand over your slip and card or cash to pay. Go to the front, hand over your slip and copy of payment slip for your medications. A little busy but it’s a great pharmacy with almost every medication you can think of.  

Also got a free water bottle with purchase. 


Good prices and I did have an updated copy of his prescription from Guatemala, which they barely looked at. Just checked the medication name and dosage. 

There is also a medical window so I am not 100% sure but it appears you can see a provider and get a prescription if you need. 

Also have a lot of baby food and other items for sale.

name: Restaurante El Refugio
description:
Safe location with cameras. Behind the restaurant El Refúgio. Very friendly restaurant staff. We stayed one night during the week. We were told that on the weekend there is loud music in all the restaurants.
There's Wi-Fi inside the restaurant. They don't charge for parking, but we consume it at the restaurant as a thank you.

local seguro, com câmeras. Atrás do restaurante El Refúgio. Equipe do restaurante muito amigável. Ficamos uma noite durante a semana. Nos falaram que no final de semana tem música alta em todos os restaurantes.
Tem wi-fi dentro do restaurante. Eles não cobram para estacionar, mas nós consumimos no restaurante como forma de agradecimento.

name: Tropigas
description:
Place to refill gas tanks
321c for an american tank of 20 L

name: Gutiérrez -Quintero #2
description:
if you need a SIM card on a Sunday. 
This place will sell you a SIM for 50. 
they were only able to recharge Tigo after we went Claro. but the place opposite helped us. everywhere else looked closed including the other place listed on the map!

name: Agua en los bomberos
description: Water tap at the fire department, we asked to use water and we were able to refill the water tank without problems. It is not drinkable. the firefighters are very friendly

name: Charly’s Restaurant and Guesthouse
description: Fantastic place to stay.  A 15-minute walk to downtown.  Proprietor is of German descent who also makes amazing German style meals.  Secure parking for our two motorbikes, quiet neighbourhood, and cold beer on tap!  Owner speaks English, German, and Spanish and some Swedish.

name: Sim Card Scam Nicaragua
description: After you enter Nicaragua there are guys who are trying to sell you a sim card. They overcharge you and tell you it's unlimited. My husband paid for the same deal 5$ in the shop, I payed 22$ at the border. Don't buy it there. Just go to a regular shop.

name: Water tap potable - Casa de la Cultura
description: Water tap in the house of culture (casa de la Cultura), it has good pressure. The hose can be connected. Potable

name: Hostal Casa Yoly
description:
A Hostal with a communal shower/toilet.
We asked the lady at the reception if its ok to just take a shower, and she agreed..
$50 Cordobas p.P.
No towel or soap provided, but clean shower and toilet.

name: Corrupt cops check point
description: Pulled over for crossing the line while driving?  Made up. He first tried to fine us on fire extinguishing but when we had one he had to make something up. Ugh. He held our license and used google translator to tell us it was 1000 cordobas or he would keep our license and we couldn’t return. We played dumb for a long while about what he was trying to do but then in the end paid $20 to just go away and get on with our life as our donation to corrupt cops of the world. Sorry I know this doesn’t make it easier for others. We did try for a good hour with sweat dripping down off us and he got tired too. Next time we will win!

name: Cerro Negro Camp Area
description: This is the area where tour groups bring people who intend to sled down Cerro Negro. You can camp here for $5 USD.

name: Shangrila - Beautiful Surf Casa
description:
We spent a week here, incredible place highly recommended. 
Emilio, the owner of the place, is very friendly, willing to help with everything. The facilities are very good, wifi, kitchen, bathrooms and electricity. in front of the beach and very close to the Popoyo wave. The common spaces are very good, hammocks, tables, barbecue and shade. 
We love this place. It also has rooms available. 
The price varies depending on the use of the facilities, the most economical and beautiful in Popoyo!

name: Taller de mecánica Heriberto Flores
description:
Incredible experience in this workshop! They repaired my car impeccably, demonstrating a high level of professionalism and attention to detail. The team was extremely friendly and helpful, making the entire process easy and hassle-free. Also, the price was very reasonable. "I will definitely recommend this shop to friends and family looking for exceptional service at a fair price!"
--
Increíble experiencia en este taller! Repararon mi auto de manera impecable, demostrando un alto nivel de profesionalismo y atención al detalle. El equipo fue extremadamente amigable y servicial, haciendo que todo el proceso fuera fácil y sin complicaciones. Además, el precio fue muy razonable. ¡Definitivamente recomendaré este taller an amigos y familiares en busca de un servicio excepcional a un precio justo!"

name: Radiadores Y Silenciadores
description:
We had a hole in our radiator wich was not possible to fix with a DIY gasket-maker or the „stop radiator-leak“ stuff.
This guys fix radiators with welding/soldering.
We paid 800C for about 1.5h work.

name: Agua Roca
description: You can buy 20L garrafons here for 80 cordobas

name: Galaxia Mobile
description: Place for SIM card for telephone. Good service and quick and cheap

name: parking lot to consiguina volcano
description: this is the parking lot where you start the hike to the volcano, nice walk, about 25min climbing, easy, but very hot, beautiful volcano!! you can see 3 countries from up there (nicaragua, Honduras and el salvador)

name: Police Bribery
description:
Established checkpoint where they allegedly use radar to check the speed of vehicles exiting the rotary (speed limit is 45km/hr).

I was stopped with the claim that I was going 71km/hr. I do not believe I was going that fast. I was also in a line of several vehicles going the same speed, but I have American plates. My Spanish is very poor. By the time I figured out what was going on, my Spanish-speaking girlfriend had agreed to pay 350Cordobas to the officer. 

He had said that he will take my license, and it would be very difficult for me. If we folded the cash into a laminated card that he gave her, we could forget that this happened, and he would let us go. He told us not to tell anyone about the experience.

name: Rancho Mérida
description: Hacienda Mérida is closed since october/23. Right next to it, there is a place called Rancho Mérida. It costed US$ 10 dollars for a car with two people. Family is very friendly. They have a large open grassy area for the cars, with a lot of mango trees. There are two entrances, and it fits big rigs too. Clean bathrooms and cold shower. If you speak to the owners, they can give you electricity. Very nice place, close to a mini market and a very good restaurant (Escuela Hotel Volcan Maderas) with good prices and the best food in Nicarágua so far.

name: Medicina Naturales de plantas deshidratadas
description:
This is a beautiful place to camp that is run by a lovely family of three: the mother Carla and her sons Carlos and Hector. They are Nicaraguans and they welcome guests in their 2 camping areas in the garden. 
Feel free to bring your own tent but if you don’t have one, they are happy to provide.

Carla has a mesmerizing garden and knows a lot about medicinal plants that she also sells as tea alongside completely natural soaps. She makes all of the products herself in the garden and they are 100% natural. It’s incredible!

The family is so lovely, knowledgeable and welcoming! We highly recommend to stay here!

If you have your own tent it’ll cost 5$pP and you are welcome to use her kitchen. If you want to rent a tent it’ll cost a little bit more.

She also has a bike rental if you want to explore the area. :)

The place is tucked away in nature. It radiates such a tranquility and serenity. You can easily walk to the beach in about 10min. 

There are also a few little shops nearby (maybe 5min walking). 

She doesn’t have wifi at the moment but TIGO Signal is available though not really strong (just a few minutes walking down the street will get you much stronger signal).

The place is connected to the road where the bus will drop you off and then it’s only 5min walking a little uphill until you reach her beautiful place. 
——
Este es un hermoso lugar para acampar que es dirigido por una encantadora familia de tres: la madre Carla y sus hijos Carlos y Hector. Son nicaragüenses y acogen a los huéspedes en sus 2 zonas de acampada en el jardín. 
Puedes traer su propia tienda de campaña, pero si usted no tiene uno, que están encantados de proporcionar.

Carla tiene un jardín fascinante y sabe mucho sobre plantas medicinales que también vende como té junto con jabones completamente naturales. Ella hace todos los productos en su jardín y son 100% naturales. Es increíble!!

La familia es amable, agradable y encantadora. Recomendamos mucho alojarse aquí! Disfrutamos mucho nuestro tiempo con la familia. 

Si tienes tu propia tienda, se costará 5$pP y puedes usar su cocina. Si quieres alquilar una tienda se costará un poco más.

También alquila bicicletas por si quieres explorar la isla :)

El lugar está rodeado de la naturaleza. Irradia tanta tranquilidad y serenidad. Se puede ir andando a la playa en unos 10 minutos. 

También hay algunas tiendecitas cerca (quizás 5min andando). 

No tiene wifi en el momento, pero el TIGO señal está disponible, aunque no muy fuerte (a pocos minutos a pie por la calle le conseguirá señal mucho más fuerte).

El lugar está conectado a la calle donde el autobús se dejará y luego es sólo 5 minutos a pie un poco subiendo hasta llegar a su hermoso lugar. :)

name: Military checkpoint
description:
Military camp and checkpoint just east outside El Pochote.

They checked my papers. Checked the surface of one of my bicycle panniers and didn't do any further checking.

I told them I want to take the dirt road to cross the border at Peñas Blancas (the main road) and that I won't cross the river (Rio naranjo).
They told me not to take the wrong turn and not cross the river. I showed them my route on my phone.

They were polite and let me pass.

name: Agua Roca
description: Garrafones of drinking water. 80 cordoba each 👍

name: Veterinarian with decent dog food
description: Can't tell you much, other than that it's here and has stuff like Purina Pro Plan. Just happened to see it while walking.

name: Movilvet (speaks great English)
description:
A nice vet clinic inside a calm, gated, middle class community, with wide streets and easy parking. Good for big rigs. Food options and pulperias right around the corner. Vets speak very good English. They also do house calls if you happen to be staying somewhere stable. 

MODERATOR NOTE: the entrance to the gated community is here 
12.20063, -86.38299

name: buena vibra camping, nica vibes restaurant.
description: really nice place to stay right in front of  the beach. lots of place with shade for big rigs. $8 for caming or parking the car, $5 hammock $10 for shared room with kitchen.$25 for private room ($20 if its more than one day)  there ir an outside bathroom. and an another for the rooms. as well a resto-bar nica vibe from a french/canadian nice guy in the same plot right on the beach.

name: Hotel & Parque Canino Lucas & Lalo’s
description:
This is the best place in Managua to leave your dogs for pet boarding or take your dogs to play for the day. Ina and her husband Osvaldo (the owners of this place) are so kind and helpful and happy to welcome campers who need to leave their dogs behind as they travel. 

- You can park here overnight only if you are leaving your dogs for pet boarding. They have bathrooms, water (non-potable) and I think you can even plug in! We didn’t stay over night as we didn’t know we could but the owners were so nice to let us know we can park in their parking lot if needed. They have a nice size parking lot and it’s gated. 

- They also do the dog travel letters for crossing the border and have a store a few mins away where they sell premium dog food like Purina Pro Plan & Royal Canin and medication for dogs like nexguard and heart worm medication. 

- Pet boarding and pet park: we left our 3 dogs here and it was wonderful!! We got videos and updates every single day of their stay which made me really happy and kept me at ease. They also offer play time for the dogs if you want to just run your dog. Their place is kept clean, and in good climate weather.

It’s also a very nice neighborhood with a few place nice spots to eat. You can contact Ina directly via WhatsApp +505-8863-8778 for more information.

name: Las Alas
description:
If you are looking for a quiet site not too far from San Juan with an amazing host. This is the place. Jarred is a really nice guy from New Zealand and he is moving fast to get this place on the map. Escamequita is a cute little town just South of busy SJDS. Plenty of space for many rigs. The road to get there and his entrance/land is perfect for large rigs going down the PanAm. There is a bit of everything on site from playground for kids to a Pickleball court.  Very cold beers are also available. There's a restaurant on site and a nice pizza oven but there's also a few more options across the street for food. The BigSky Stables is also just a few minutes away and Hermosa beach is about a 10-15min drive. Normal amenities such as water, toilet, shower and electricity is available. Cost is $10/night but may change depending on size of party.

Please contact Jarred on WhatsApp at +50586325878

name: Puma Water tap
description:
Water can be recharged for the motorhome tank, very friendly staff.

Se puede recargar agua para el tanque del motorhome, personal muy amable. Agua potable.

name: Hostel Paradiso
description: This the hostel parking. nice big parking where to park van or bigger rig. They let you camp there for 8$ or 10$ including pancakes for breakfast. They let you use all facilities, including Kayaks, tubes and all. Really nice place with good vibes. the restaurant is apparently very good too.

name: Ometepe Vet Clinic
description:
Was told by a couple of other different vets that this (Dr. Faran) is one of the best vets in the country. Speaks perfect English as well. Reasonably priced. Does not do health certificates.
Literally right next door to a campground.

name: Artemisa Animal Hospital
description:
An extremely modern, well appointed animal hospital. Owner is a Canadian woman, and has relationships with a network of very good vets throughout the country. She also does "exotic" and endangered animal rescue and rehab.
Very friendly and very helpful. If she can't help you, she'll tell you who can.
